description:
It was my turn to pick the place for boys dinner and I could not pass up the pictures I saw of the food & ambiance. I made a reservation for a party of 5 at 7:00pm. I'm glad I did too because when we got to the restaurant there was only one low table left.

I immediately noticed that the restaurant was just as beautiful as in the pictures. The place is wonderfully decorated with the Mediterranean style lighting and colors.

The food was delicious. My group split the hummus, lamb meatballs, and the Turkish manti (dumplings). Group consensus was the dumplings were amazing, though my personal favorite was the meatballs. We then had a salad, with two entrees of the half chicken and the braised duck kabsa. All of it was quickly devoured.

Between the 5 of us we spent about $50 (we had cocktails too) but if we were more on a budget we definitely could have cut out a small plate and/or the salad (but definitely not the cocktails.)
author: Stephen P.

description:
We were in SFO for a conference, and were looking for a place to dine for a team of 8. We happened to find this place on Yelp, and were excited to try this highly rated restaurant out. The servers were extremely friendly, and our server, Noah, was awesome.

There are tons of vegetarian options in the appetizer and sides sections, but unfortunately, none in the entree section, which was a disappointment. I do hope that they add at least one vegetarian entree on their menu, so vegetarians like me don't have to fill up on appetizers and sides.

- Bazlama: This is their Turkish flatbread, that you can eat with hummus and other dips. This was decent, but wish it was warm.
- Hummus: The hummus was decent, but not delicious. 
- Muhammara: I ordered this without the poached egg. I definitely liked the flavor of this spread. It would have tasted much better if the bread was warmer.
- Winter Ratatouille: This was delicious....I ate this with the Turkish flatbread and filled myself with it.
- Blistered 'Shishito' Peppers: This was really good and not spicy at all. I was scared to try it first as I cannot handle spice. But it was surprisingly good.
- Crispy New Potatoes: Delicious!!! Perfectly seasoned and cooked.

We did order Baklava, but the nuts inside tasted stale, so we had to send it back.

The ambiance of this place is really cool, and we all had a great time. I heard from my colleagues that the shrimp, lamb, and the octopus was amazing. For me, the food was good overall, but I do wish they had a vegetarian entree.
author: Ani J.

description:
Feeling lazy we ate here on Friday night, due to the close proximity to the boyfriends apartment.
The restaurant seemed busy with the usual Friday night FiDi/downtown crowd which includes more than a few large backpack-toting tech workers.

The host sat us at our small table, to get to my seat I had to climb over a few of those aforementioned backpacks *eye roll*
The server came up to us within 30 seconds to ask for our drink order, which was super fast and we had obviously not had time to look at the menu, of course we explained that and she came back 5 mins later once we'd had a look.
We ordered the hummus, obviously, which was good. The burrata and heirloom tomato salad (my fave) the croquets (delicious) and the lamb, which was the worst, and most expensive dish. For $45 we did not expect cheap and fatty cuts of lamb. I barely ate one piece. The boyfriend ate a few pieces and did not enjoy this dish at all. 
Service was fine, albeit a bit rushed throughout. I may come back here for lunch, but not somewhere you want to spend more than an hour. For a $160 dinner for two people inc drinks and service I think you can do better in this city than Barcha
author: Marie D.

description:
Absolutely excellent food. Above average service. Not cheap.
Party of 4, each got 1 sandwich + 1 soft drink, with tax and tip, $30/each.

The sandwiches are open-ended wrap style and quite juicy. Be careful how you handle them. They come with a side of potatoes or a salad. We ordered both, but I must say that the potatoes are amazing. They have a garlic flavor and are a little crispy. Choose the salad if you don't like garlic, but I loved them.

My shrimp "sandwich" was not very filling, but it was wonderfully flavorful. Having those potatoes on the side helped. Big eaters may want a dessert afterwards. Light eaters may take half their sandwich home for dinner!
author: Marvin M.

description:
The food here is really amazing. Came here in a group of 4 for dinner and we ordered 3 mezzo plates and 1 entree. We ordered the lamb meatballs, sautéed white prawns, Muhammara, and Rotisserie half chicken.

Everything was phenomenal! Great flavor and absolutely delicious. Only downside is how quickly we finished the food given how delicious the food was and the slightly small portion sizes.
author: Jenny J.

description:
The short: uniquely delicious food

My coworker made a reservation for 7 and on arrival, we were immediately led to the long table at the back. The waiters were friendly and the space reminded me of what Morocco and Tunisia may look like. The decor from the pendant lamps and the photos of tubs of spices felt very transformative. The noise level was far too loud for my taste and the music seemed off.

This place isn't keen on order changes as a lot of things are pre-made. A colleague tried to change something in the salad (not able to) and I asked if something could be removed from the soup (not able to). However, I ended up settling on the olive oil poached tuna and a saffron basmati rice side. The two together are so filling and probably could be split in half for two solid meals. The tuna was poached too long for me and ended up being more tough and dry than I had envisioned it to be, but the dressing and flavors were amazingly delectable. The rice was so colorful and flavorful that I practically inhaled all of it.

My favorite part was probably ogling at the beautiful plates.

Verdict: I would be interested in going back to try out other unique food pieces that I seldom see elsewhere
author: Catherine W.

description:
Came in a group of 6 on a weeknight with a reservation and we were seated immediately. We had a lovely server who was very attentive and started us off with drinks (the sousse tasted like juice and I loved it). We then split 4 apps: muhammara, Turkish manti (ordered 2), lamb meatballs, Spanish octopus. The manti and octopus were really good. We finished with the duck kabsa, which I shared with my boyfriend. We didn't finish, but that's because we usually have lighter dinners. 

Overall, this is a convenient place to hang with friends after work with amazing food. It's definitely SF finance district pricing, so I would only come every once in a while. 

Pro tip: The apps are big enough for maybe a group of 3-4 to share, but definitely not enough for 6 to share.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I was told the dinner menu is more extensive than the lunch menu so I came for dinner.

I came, I saw, I tasted and OMG the total experience was outstanding. 

Very clean and the did not wait long to be seated, but it did fill up quick.

Hats off to the staff. GM Jonathan the waitress and waiter Laure-Anne, Noah, Tiffany and now the food. We ordered the chicken which was crispy on the outside and moist tender on the inside and so delicious and the potatoes that came with it was very flavorful. The all lamb meatballs with the sauce and cheese was great and the hummus with bread it came with 1st rate.   

Can't wait to come try the rest of the menu
author: Ahmed H.

description:
Wow, what a treat this place is! The food at Barcha had the 3 F's that I look for when dining: Fresh. Flavorful. Filling. 

We ordered the Turkish Manti which was my first time having this dish and oh my goodness, I can't believe I've been missing out all these years! The yogurt sauce on top was a great touch to balance out the spice of the filling. Next we got a summer salad with seasoned pita chip croutons which added a nice spice against the refreshing avocado and cucumber. 

Next same a  shredded lamb dish that was mixed in with rice with a tangy yogurt sauce and a fried egg on top -- I wish I knew the name of the dish but it was fabulous! We got summer corn with feta on the side and really rounded out our meal well!
author: Danielle D.

description:
Turkish, Tunisian, Moroccan and Spanish dishes all served!

Established in 2015 by Kais Bouzidi, the owner of Sens restaurant, Barcha offers delicious variety of Mediterranean dishes for lunch and dinner. Executive chef Michael Adams has done a fantastic job of bringing it all together. 

I was there for lunch with a colleague and we shared a combination plate that included three or four items, all mouth wateringly tasty! The seating space was bright and comfortable. Outside seating is also available and that could be a big plus on a beautiful day. The servers were very good at their jobs and took care of us as best as we expected. We did not order any cocktails , but the bar looked comfortable and the bartenders very capable! I must go back to confirm that!
author: Afshin A.

description:
Barcha is located in an area that we typically do not go to on the weekends because most things are not open, but we found Barcha on Yelp/Open Table and thought we'd give it a try.

We had a table of three and all started well. We ordered 4 apps and a Caesar Salad to share.  The food was good and the service started out well.  

We had:
Hummus with Bazlama (Turkish flatbread). The hummus was decent but nothing special but the bread was delicious, only thing is there was not enough for the hummus so we ended up ordering a side of veggies ($3) to go with it.

Chicken & Manchego Croquettes. The texture of the chicken inside was not what I was expecting nor was I expecting the sauce to be so sweet with the first bite. However as I continued to eat these they grew on me and I liked them a lot.

Lamb Meatballs. Good but nothing special. 

Turkish Manti (spiced beef dumplings, garlic yogurt, chili oil, dried mint). These were very good. I did not know was to expect but was pleasantly surprised.  

All in all the food was good and I would go back and try some more dishes. However as the night went on the service slowed down tremendously and it was very disappointing. Also all of the desserts on Yelp looked delicious but the offerings the night we went were mostly mouse and not as appealing.
author: Danielle B.

description: I love this place. Team and I had lunch here after give back program. We ordered mostly the shawarma which came with either fried potatoes or green salad. Servings were huge which is why it's quite pricy for lunch. However the flavors of each dish was super tasty and delish. I ordered the spicy lamb shawarma.  It was super good and huge serving! I had to take home the other half for my lovey! The potatoes were nicely fried and full of flavors as well. I will have to come back here for dinner with my lovey! Trust!!!
author: Claudine V.

description:
So here's the deal, they won't seat you unless your entire party is here. Look I get it, but when it's not even packed, and my party is 2 people, there shouldn't be a problem for me to sit down and wait while my friend is on her way. I could have ordered a drink while I was waiting, and right now I'm just annoyed, so way to start off on a bad note especially cause I chose to come here based on some good reviews. Bleh.

Anyway, Barcha is in my opinion in a really good location. Smack down in the middle of financial district. Great place to entertain a large party or a place to invite a girlfriend or two to share some small plates and drink. My waiter saved this review from being a 3 star. She was great! Gave some good recommendations on the menu and even threw a free dish cause the kitchen messed up on an order. Yay!

Here's what we got: 
- Turkish Manti - Don't hate on it until you try it. Really delicious!

- Chicken and Manchego Croquettes - Wish I ordered more. I could eat this all day. 

- Lamb Meatballs - Yummy. Period.

- Crispy Potatoes - Nothing out of this world but nice to much on if you're drinking here
author: Tina M.

description:
I only have a to-go lunch experience and I thought this place was amazing!

I had the lamb gyro with a side of roasted potatoes...best lamb gyro and best roasted potatoes I've ever had in my life and I don't say this lightly. 

I LOVE lamb but the way that this lamb is cut is much juicier and a more satisfying bite which adds to the texture and flavor the meal. The gryo itself had a good mix of yogurt sauce and fresh veggies. 

I don't normally expect anything from roasted potatoes when I order it but these potatoes are life-changing. Roasted with a fine outer crisp, creamy center, and seasoned with an excellent blend of spices. 

I highly recommend this place. I plan to be back soon!
author: Sofia R.

description:
Saw this place on the way to a lunch and there was a line out the door at 11:45am! Decided to check it out for dinner. At first, we were taken aback by the prices. But the cocktails and food were phenomenal that we decided it was totally worth it.

The Smokey Persian cocktail is delicious. Highly recommend the manti, lamb meatballs, and shakshuka.
author: Sherry L.

description:
I'm a frequent traveler to SF for work and as such, eat plenty of meals on someone else's dime.

Let me be clear: the meal I had at Barcha would have been as delicious on my dime :)

Absolutely sumptuous shared appetizers: hummus, beef dumplings, flatbread, octopus...executed with such flair and finesse as to make a grown woman weep for joy. Not just another client dinner where I surreptitiously peek at my phone under the table and wonder if we can all it an early night. I wanted to keep tasting the yummy bites and ridiculously well seasoned main dishes!

California cool, casual vibe with food that would not be out of place in a much more stuffy setting. A+++
author: Deborah D.

description: Awesome Mediterranean tapas place to try! Lots of special dishes in tapas size. I think I need to come back soon to try the rest on their menu. We had hummus, Turkish manti, chicken manchego croquettes and braised duck kabsa. Yum yum, all tasted delicious, nothing over powering. Service is great. Very friendly, helpful staff!
author: Shell J.

description:
I found myself here for dinner a few weeks ago and I definitely fell in love with the ambience of the place. Upon walking in, the first thing I noticed were the beautifully designed lights throughout the restaurant! There was also a nice outdoor patio which is where we choose to sit. We had a number of things: hummus, octopus, lamb meatballs, and croquettas for starters, shakshuka, salmon, and rack of lamb for the main courses, and dark chocolate pot de crème, Turkish coffee ice cream, pecan baklava, and gateau basque, for dessert.

Between all of the apps, the chicken & manchego croquettas were the highlight for me! Incredibly crispy on the outside with a warm, inviting, tasty inside. I would recommend getting a few of these for a table. As for the main courses, my favorite would be the rack of lamb! I love finding a place that knows how to cook lamb perfectly. The shakshuka was also amazing and it felt comforting to eat with how hearty and piping hot it was. Lastly, was dessert! We all agreed the best one out of the bunch was the Turkish coffee ice cream! It had mascarpone, lady fingers, and cocoa nibs. 

Overall, the service was above and beyond, ambience beautiful, and food delicious. I'll have to visit their sister restaurant Sens sometime too!
author: Maleah M.

description:
This restaurant is located close to the Embarcadero in the financial district. The best part about this restaurant is that they have happy hour. My favorite from the many plates that they served was the croquettes. Next up is their salmon. They make it perfectly, crispy skin and tender and juicy inside. They serve most of their plates tapa style, so it's perfect for sharing with family. They also have very many cocktails that you should try. My favorite was the Marbella. To end it all, you should order their desserts. The service is exceptional. What we ended up getting: 
-Hummus
-Octopus
-Lamb Meatballs
-Turkish Manti
-Croquettas
-Salmon
-Lamb
-Merguez Shakshuka
author: Charlene F.

description:
Came here for work Happy Hour, they were very accommodating to large groups. Minimum spend for large parties inside was $3K, outside was $1.2K.  Hope that helps other folks trying to organize company happy hours. 

Best dishes I tasted included the beef skewers, shrimp scampi, and baklava.

Great selection of alcohol. I didn't care much for the the cocktails, too sweet for my taste. Interesting import selection of beers.
author: Ben C.

description: Noah was the BEST server! So attentive, pleasant and accommodating. Food out of this world. We ordered mostly tapas to taste for variety- no disappointments. Turkish dumplings were my fav. Husband loved lamb meatballs! Will visit again if ever in the area.
author: Elizabeth N.

description:
I had dinner here with a couple of friends.  I arrived early so I waited for them at the bar. The place was packed, but I still managed a seat at the bar and enjoyed a very well prepared vodka martini.

We sat and ordered a few dishes to share.  Two apps an one entree.  As apps we had the lamb meatballs and the octopus.  The entree was the stuffed baby eggplant.

Everything was really really good.  The meatballs were to die for, the octopus was devine and the eggplant was really flavorfull.

Service was good, and the ambiance is very modern - good date for a 20-something but I don't know I would bring my old lady here.  Place is great to share excellent mediterranean cuisine with friends and co-workers.
author: Massimo M.

description:
Good Mediterranean food... definitely recommended. 4.5 stars for very flavorful and good food. 

Starters: we loved Hummus and the Lamb Meatballs. The Hummus was one of the best I have had in recent months. We ended up ordering the hummus twice, as we loved the pepper that came with it and the flat bread that came with it. The bread was soft and very similar to indian flat bread. We all really liked it. The Lamb Meatballs were also very flavorful and especially the combination of the hummus with the meatballs was amazing. We also ordered the Shishito Peppers and they were also good in combination with the hummus but were a little less flavorful than what I had hoped for. 

Main course: It turned out to be a Lamb centric night for us. As a group we ordered the Shakshuka with Lamb Merguez and the Rack of Lamb. Both were amazing and tasted nice and different. If you want something with tomato gravy the Shakshuka is a very good choice and the potatoes and cheese is very good. The potatoes were surprisingly flavorful. We ordered with a side of Persian rice. This was a very nice side order and it tasted like Berry Pulao that we have back home in India, coming from the Persian community there. 

Sweets: we tried the Baklava and Basque Cake. One of the best Baklava's I have had in SF and the apricot went very well with it. The Basque cake was also good, slightly less sweet than the Baklava but still very good nonetheless. 

The drinks were good and I really liked the Sousse. The blackberries in it were an amazing touch and I liked the small carafe that it was served in. 

Barcha turned out to be a lot of fun and I hope to go back here for the flavors and good ambience. Enjoy good food and good service in the heart of the city..
author: Nipun S.

description:
This is my go to client lunch spot. It's easy to book a reservation online (so you don't have to actually talk to anyone on the phone)  It's in a convenient location with ample seating for small or larger parties (2-8 people).  Their wait staff is quick and professional and the menu solid.  It's reasonably priced that despite who has to pick up the tab (you or the client) no one is getting in trouble with the boss.

I've had uncomfortable lunch meetings here (with vendors that basically mansplain things to me for 50 minutes) and I have to grin and bear it ... at least the food is good.
author: Kathleen W.

description: I had a great time here!  The staff is really friendly and the place is easy to find.  There are plenty of seating options (sit at the bar, table, bench, or outside.)  The drinks and food came out pretty quickly.  My favorite is probably their potatoes with the 2 sauces: Harissa and I think something garlicky (it was white.)  So the lamb shawarma I ordered had great flavor.  I'd prolly order the same thing again.  I'd recommend the place and would go back.  Take notice of their hours of operation as they only do dinner on Saturday nights.
author: Shaun W.

description:
Pretty good spot downtown to grab a bite. I came here at lunch and it was super busy thanks to all the companies in the area. That said it can get kind of loud if you're trying to have a conversation, but there's also outside seating. 

The food came pretty quickly and the servers were attentive. The Chef's Plate is meant for 1 but can definitely be shared between 2 and gives you a good variety. My favorites were probably the Turkish Manti (basically Turkish beef dumplings) and the croquettes (they come with truffle honey).
author: Grace C.

description:
As a middle eastern guy I know a good shawarma sandwich when I see it. The side of potatoes was also very good.
I read somewhere here that the Turkish coffee ice cream is amazing and I'll have to agree.

Also the staff was extremely friendly.
author: Rafic K.

description:
Barcha is in a very convenient location which I like. The restaurant itself is very cramped on the inside; you have to be really careful not to bump into things and people when you dine here. The kabobs here are very good but the rest of the items on the menu is lukewarm and lackluster. Service is really bad. I have been here 3 times and I do not think I and my guests ever had a good server here. It is tapas style so be expecting to pay a lot for a little piece of food. The communal bathroom was very awkward and, again, cramped - you might also run into employees trying to part the curtains to exit the "restroom" area. As a customer, I feel like I am always in the way of the employees and the furniture here.

Barcha is not terrible, but it is also not as nice as some of the other restaurants I had been to featuring Mediterranean food or in this financial district of SF. I might go back but probably in the far future because of the consistently bad service I received.
author: Robert M.

description:
My husband and I had dinner here last week and I immediately noticed the cute outside seating areas. Even though the areas were well lit, there were no heating lamps so we went to go sit inside. 

The next thing I noticed were the huge, beautiful chandeliers that were all different shapes. The light shining through the chandeliers added some texture to the walls - almost looked like wallpaper. There was also a cute booth on the side that kind of looked like a VIP table. 

Our drink orders were taken not too long after we were seated. The food came out pretty quickly, as well. My hubby and I always order way too much food. To start, we had the grilled spanish octopus, croquettas, tuna crudo, and lamb meatballs. The octopus was really tender. The croquettas were creamy on the inside and had a touch of sweetness from the truffle honey. The crudo was my least favorite. It looked like poke so I was expecting/missing avocado, and it needed more acidity. My favorite, though, were the lamb meatballs. They were so flavorful and moist. Something about lamb and feta together...yum!

For our entrees, we ordered the rotisserie chicken and beef kebab with a side of basmati rice. I was already getting kinda full from all the appetizers so I didn't really need the rice, but it was still good. The chicken portion was huge! It was moist and had good flavor. I liked the way the kebab was presented - our server slid the meet off the skewer for me. The kebab was cooked to a perfect medium rare, it was so tender and juicy. I don't know what they did to that kale but it was addicting! I wanted to save room for dessert so I only took a few bites of the kebab and saved the rest for lunch the next day. 

The pecan baklava was quite delicious. It's pretty filling so I took a few bites and packed that up, as well. My hubby had the gâteau basque which was a cake with pears. That was pretty yummy, too. 

I loved that they played hip hop and r&b.  Service was great - our server made some great recommendations and checked on us pretty frequently. Also, I learned that they plan on adding heat lamps to the outside seating areas. 

I would definitely come back to this place.
author: Rose A.

description:
I was very happy with my experience at Barcha. It came very close to five stars. Here's what I had:

- Poached egg with pita: absolutely delicious, though without being overpowering. A really pleasant variation on traditional red hummus.
- Octopus: very tasty, though a little chewy. Excellent accompanying sauces and olives.
- Poached tuna: probably the standout surprise item, this was the best cooked tuna I've ever had. As a salad, this was exceptionally interesting and palatable. I'd love to have this one again.
- Rotisserie chicken: sumac is my favorite spice, so I couldn't resist. The side was potatoes, bacon, and mushrooms stewed in the juices of the chicken. That was very good. The only unfortunate matter was the chicken itself, which was a little more toward the bland/unspiced side, for a rotisserie chicken. I would have given Barcha five stars otherwise.

Décor etc. was lovely.
author: John L.

description: I enjoyed my lunch at Barcha.  Everything from service, price and, of course, food were on point.  They have a nice array of salads.  You can add meats and they'll serve them on the side.  The hummus was fantastic.  I also recommend the baklava (a la mode style) for a happy ending.
author: Angel S.

description:
Fantastic spot. I came here for lunch and the food quality is excellent. The food is not cheap but worth the extra premium one pays for quality. 

MUST HAVE:

arugula and heirloom chicories salad with lamb meatballs. The greens were amazing - tastes like coming straight from Ferry building farmer's market, with a bit of delicious bitterness from chicory. And the lamb meatballs are pretty tender here but can be less hard on the surface. 

Ratatouille side - fantastic intense flavors with middle eastern influence. Excellent. 

SOLID:

Turkish Manti / beef dumpling - hearty dish. Love the yogurt that goes with it. 

Blistered shishito peppers - pretty good. 

AVOID:
chop salad: even though this is one of the recommended dishes, it was so so. The vinegar was a bit too strong. The greens are commonplace. The crunchy flatbread was interesting but didn't particularly go with the greens. 


I would recommend reserving beforehand for a table to avoid waiting.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Barcha is a happening place located in the financial area of downtown San Francisco.  Good luck finding parking.....
However, I came here for a business meeting and I would highly recommend making a reservation.  Seriously, this place is busy!  And service is great.
I ordered one of their specialty lemonades to start.  For my lunch I had the slow roasted spiced chicken sandwich.  It was delicious - and a nice sized portion that I was not able to finish.
My only real problem is that it was quite noisy, and tightly packed, so it was hard to hear the person I was dining with and I couldn't push my seat back because the table behind me was so close.  But the food is good and service is quick.
author: Mara K.

description:
I was very pleasantly surprised by my experience at Barcha. I expected it to be a typical factory churning out expense account dinners and over priced cocktails for the FiDi commuting crowd.

But the food was really well done. I particularly loved the Shakshuka and lamb. All of the desserts were spot on delicious.

Very BART accessible for any out of towners too!
author: Karen T.

description:
I've been to Barcha a few times for lunch, and have always had an excellent meal. Having come here last night for a friend's birthday dinner, I've now finally tried both their lunch AND dinner menus. 

First off, you can't really go wrong with anything you order here, as pretty much everything I've tried here so far has ranged from decently good to outright delicious! Some of my favorites however is the sandwiches with a side of their crispy potatoes and mixed greens. I kid you not, these potatoes are literally the best crispy potatoes I've ever had in my life! I don't know what fairy dust they use to season them with, but the taste, aroma, and perfect texture of the skin makes it quite a treat on the tastebuds! And while the greens typically get relegated to being pushed on the side (sorry mom!) at most joints, the mixed greens here have been marinated in a delicious red wine vinaigrette and taste perfectly delectable! 

As for the sandwiches, I've tried several of the shawarmas and skewers and have enjoyed them all. Keep in mind that the skewers are not the typical meat skewers that you might imagine. Instead, they are your choice of proteins and other deliciousness wrapped in a pita bread, cut into sections, and "skewered" with toothpicks. 

And while the dinner menu certainly was good, it just didn't quite carry the same level of appeal that the lunch menu did. 

Seating is available both indoors and out, and the ambience is definitely on the more upscale level. Service is very friendly and attentive, with very consistent refills of water and meal check-ins.
author: Alex C.

description:
The place is very beautiful and the menu looks so promising, however the real thing was a bit disappointing. 
The chopped salad was with no taste at all, included lots of lettuce very little tomatoes, olives and one tiny piece of avocado ( when you mentioned in the menu that the salad includes avocado I wish to get an avocado).
The shakshuka was too sweet that it felt that someone putted too much sugar in it. 
We barely touched in the shishito peppers and when the waitress took it he didn't even ask if everything is okay with the dish. 
The only tasty dish was a spread of peppers and cashew. 
I gave 2 stars and not 1 since the drinks were good and the host was so generous.
author: Lee S.

description:
Always love this spot. 
The decor and ambiance is so warm and welcoming.
We had the chicken croquettes, kale Caesar, beef kabob, ratatouille, lamb meatballs. So were great!! Faves: croquettes and Caesar
Also, the smokey bourbon drink is on point.
author: Amy O.

description:
Came here for a Monday lunch with a colleague and really enjoyed the assortment of food on their menu. Definitely recommend making a reservation, because they were packed during the lunch rush. The service was excellent as the waiters were very attentive, refilling our waters constantly and delivering food in a timely manner. 

We ordered the chicken and manchego croquettes and their crispy potatoes as appetizers. Both were tasty! The croquettes were a cheesy, fried ball of deliciousness so you can't go wrong ordering these!  

We also split the strawberry and arugula salad with the spiced chicken shawarma sandwich which came with a side of their saffron basmati rice. I could go without ordering the chicken sandwich again, but loved both the appetizers and the salad. There was more than enough food shared between the two of us and I ended up taking the rest of the salad home.

Would definitely want to come back for dinner and give their Shakshuka and Chocolate Pot de Creme a try!
author: Isabella L.

description:
Been here for lunch. Been here for dinner. Never paid for it myself. Always been on the company. And never would I pay for it on my own. 

Let's start w lunch. Apps here are great. Get the hummus. Get the octopus. GET THE TURKISH FLATBREAD. All the salads with their added proteins are also delish. But damn, have you seen the prices? Of course these kinds of spots abuse the financial district crowds with obscene prices for things that should not cost that much. $20+ for a lunch. With my own money, no thanks. 

Now let's talk about dinner. Apps are all pretty much the same. Also very good. Not much difference. But a glance at the entrees will have you gasping WHAT THE WHAT?! Nearly $40 for every entree. For skewers. Get real. I got the sea bass, which was good, but seriously, Barcha??? Seriously?? No. This is ridiculously overpriced. And according to the coworkers - none of which finished their skewers - the meat was mediocre at best. Again, I'd never come here on my own dime. Food also took forever and a day to come out. 

4 stars for lunch. 2 stars for dinner. 3 stars for a review of both combined.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Their food is beautiful! (and really pretty tasty too).

We came in for a quick afterwork/touristing snack - which is a good thing that we only wanted appetizers because they don't serve their full menu till 5:30. We came at 4:45 on a Wednesday and although there was lots of space then, the host did say they were fully booked, so that we would have to leave by 6 - which was our intention anyways. We sat inside because it was a little chilly, but they did have a good amount of outdoor seating - although it would be loud out there (it wasn't particularly quiet inside either).

The Hummus was solid - definitely homemade. The flatbread was standard.

Grilled Duck Meatballs were most disappointing. They just didn't have that much flavor. I did think that the fig paired nicely with it though.

Potato and Feta Croquettes were quite nice. a little less feta-y than I had hoped (I do LOVE cheese), but they were very well friend - nice a crunchy, but not over done, with a good consistency inside.  

Turkish Manti - these were SO good! Could have eaten many more! The spiced beef inside was very good, but what really stole the show was the garlic yogurt and brown butter tomato sauce and how they paired. Wouldn't necessarily think that the combo would be that stunning - but it was really just perfect and such an amazing balance of complex flavors.

They do have happy drinks - so look for that. 

It costs what you would expect "tapas" to cost in the FiDi. Hopefully you already know this is not the type of restaurant for you if you are looking for a bargain meal.
author: Sarah C.

description: Barcha is an awesome Mediterranean fine dinning in the heart of SF downtown. Their chicken shawarma for lunch is tasteful and their dinner appetizers were great. I would rate the Lamb Meatballs and Sauteed Gulf White Prawns as their best appetizers. The grilled Spanish octopus and Muhammara would come close seconds on the must have dinner appetizers. The salmon for main was also very flavor full.
author: Soumen B.

description:
If you don't live in SF and are just a tourist visiting, don't even waste your time with this place. I had a map in my hand which I had used to get to the restaurant because my phone died, so they realized I was a tourist and they quickly went from being half-nice to completely ignoring me, even sitting other people that had come in after me when the restaurant was not even full. I was hoping the food would at least be great but it wasn't even that good, plus they are pricey. The lady at the front (i believe she was the manager) was a complete primadonna, continually checking around to see if you are done with your meal and giving you the look making you feel awkward if you stay just a minute too long after you've paid your bill.
San Francisco has so many wonderful restaurants, do yourself a favor and go somewhere else, somewhere were they actually value their customers
author: Roxy S.

description: Very tasty Mediterranean sandwiches that are really more like grilled wraps. Busy at lunch time and seems trendy.
author: Tim S.

description:
This place has great decor - it feels spacious, modern, fancy but also friendly and casual. Noticed a lot of people coming here as dates or small groups to catch up.

Service was A+ super friendly, always made sure we were doing well.

I highly recommend the peppers and garlic shrimp. Both were amazing!! Spot on w the flavors and execution. I enjoyed it so much!!!! Must order

The duck meatballs were ok. I thought there was going to be more duck flavor. The texture was like a chicken meatball. Confused lol it is served w mustard sauce 

The potato side was ok. They were cooked to perfection. Soft but still nice bite. Very slightly crispy. Wished there was more salt. Compared to first two dishes - pepper and garlic, this one didn't pop as much.
author: Heidi C.

description: i've been here three times during lunch, and every time i go, i'm casually asked if i'd like additions and/or options to my food selection(s). i like the offers, but they should include, "for $xx more, you may add ..." but asking me in such a way as to imply it's included is dishonest and deceitful. however, the *constant* up-selling here is ridiculous and highly annoying. politely responding that i don't want salad that isn't included with the meal i've chosen, and then asking again (and AGAIN?!), will get a "i'm sorry, i thought i already answered that question" response. very strange...
author: Torrpedo T.

description:
A coworker and I came here for lunch on Monday. We made a reservation a few days in advance to get the time we wanted. It was super busy so I recommend making a reservation! 
They have a good selection of appetizers and lunch dishes. We opted to share the chicken & manchego croquettes and crispy new potatoes to start. Then we split a slow roasted spiced chicken sandwich and the arugula & strawberry salad. All the food was SUPER TASTY. I can't pick a favorite between the croquettes/salad/potatoes. The sandwich did not taste spicy as I was expecting but it was good also. 
There was more than enough food so we ended up taking some of it home which was great for a snack later.
The staff were friendly and very attentive. 
The cocktails looked so good. Next time I'll come in the evening and try those!
author: Denise M.

description: Barcha is great for dinners that shouldn't feel dive-y or stuffy. Like, when your friends from New York are in town or when you want to hang out with new coworkers or go on a nice date. Try to book a reso if you're going for dinner because lots of other folks in the soma/fidi area have figured this out :). I like going with small groups and ordering a bunch of the apps menu like the manti, eggplant, and kale salad.
author: Meryam B.

description:
Lunch review.

Falafel - 2/5

Chef's plate:
Spicy pork shawarma - 2/5
Lamb leg skewer - 3/5

Overall, "I've experienced better."
author: Mark O.

description:
Loved the ambiance here - came here with friends and that was definitely the right call as we were able to order a bunch of dishes. 

Their hummus was SO delicious and they served it with a Turkish flatbread which reminded me of garlic naan, SO GOOD! Also ordered the octopus and shrimp which were both tasty. They had some egg/mushroom thing that we didn't think was anything special.. Lamb meatballs were also not bad, slightly on the dry side, but the flavor made up for it.

And then for entrees, we ordered the roasted chicken, beef kebobs and basmati rice. All left full and very satisfied!
author: Kim I.

description:
Barcha exudes a fun, vibrant surrounding while offering up colorful and flavorful tapa Mediterranean dishes! 

It's semi-casual dining and a spot on restaurant to simply be at leisure. 

Their duck meatballs are a win, scallops are of mini, zesty bites and feta topped croquettes, is a sure bet. 

I like how they offer wine in carafes, which is sizable.

Staff is accommodating and attentive.  I like the chef's counter where you get to see the cooking done! 

The presentation of their entrees, pop!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I went there twice, all for work lunch. 
Service is pretty quick. I like their salads. I had the green salad and the sweet potato salad. The latter is obviously heavier. Great fiber and very fulfilling!
You got to try the Turkish coffee ice cream! It's AMAZING!
author: Isabelle L.

description: I was in town on business a couple weeks ago and went to Barcha for lunch.  A big, busy place with lots of light and great energy.  Service was prompt and friendly.  Tons of vegan options.  The starter hummus was delicious.  For lunch I went with the falafel wrap and a side salad.  Both were excellent - light and tasty, perfect portions.  Perfect lunch.  I wish I lived in SF and could eat here regularly.
author: Tom M.

description: Standout dishes included the kale salad, the flatbread, and the peppers. The restaurant is loud and young. The GM is a gem - dapper, efficient, and kind.
author: Morris R.

description: Wasn't impressed. Typical SF overpriced drinks and food with small portions. If you really feel the need to spend $35 for an average main then this for you. The service was good however. Also, not a lot of good low-carb options on this menu for the Keto folks.
author: Jeff A.

description: Their food tastes so good! It really makes my day!!! I like the Chicken croquettes and corn soup of the day. You must try it!
author: Jooo L.

description:
I went here recently.  The beer menu was good, mixed drinks were pretty good.  We had the Chicken and Manchego Croquettes, Octopus, and Prawns to share. The Croquettes were really good, prawns were fine, and the Octopus i didn't like so much. For my entree i had the Eggplant stuffed with rice and goat cheese.   It was more cheesy than i expected.  Both my entree and the salmon were small, but my friend ordered the Shakshuka which was large and also pretty good.

This is a good place for business meals, a little on the expensive side, but the space is pretty comfortable and well decorated.
author: Michael E.

description:
I didn't think I would like this place, but I ended up really enjoying the food here.

Came with a coworker on a weekday with reservations for right when they opened. We were quickly sat inside. The server was super attentive, came over right away and asked what we wanted to drink and if we were ready, what we wanted to eat. Having both never been here before, we asked what she would recommend. We settled on ordering the croquettes (which were super super yummy), the chef's plate (which we shared with the spicy pork and the lamb meatballs), 2 of the special lemonades, and 2 of the mint teas to end our meal. 

Everything was very well seasoned and just so yummy. I was so surprised about how much I actually enjoyed this place. The service was great and the food came out promptly. When we were leaving, the place was packed, so I recommend making a reservation and coming earlier if possible. I will definitely be back to try their dinner and will be taking clients here in the future.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
I spent two weeks in Greece hitting up hidden gems and food stands.  I've never had Shwarma (get the veal and turkey) this excellent in my life.  I would honestly go back tonight for dinner.  That good.  

Excellent ambiance, service, and even delicious pickled vegetables and salad on the side.  You must go now.
author: Kyle C.

description:
I really liked this place. The food is good and distinctive (Middle Eastern + decent portions), ambiance is really cute, and it's great value (~$20 pp) considering the ambiance and service-level!

Ordered the shakshuka for dinner + lamb sausage and it was good portions for two people. I recommend ordering the lamb sausage add on because they provide a lot of it and it adds great flavor to the dish. My two other friends ordered salads and those looked good too.

The ambiance is also nice. Tables are fairly close together but couldn't hear anyone else's conversation. Service is also great!

Would give 4.5 stars if I could.
author: Amy G.

description:
Fantastic for lunch. Great vibe to the place and server was both knowledgeable and helpful with my gluten allergy. I made it clear that it wasn't just a dietary restriction, but severe as in Celiac's disease level. He checked with kitchen on falafel prep - while the ingredients were gluten-free, they fry it in the same fryer as other items that have gluten. He says they're working on making it fully gluten-free so maybe they'll have that figured out by my next visit. 

For now though, I was perfectly happy with the Vegan Quinoa (roasted winter vegetables, red cabbage, apples, golden raisins, cilantro, mustard vinaigrette). It was perfectly seasoned and the combination of flavors and textures - moist quinoa, sweet plump golden raisins, tart granny apple triangle slices, tender bittersweet brussel sprout halves, subtly sweet bite-sized pieces of cauliflower, and crunchy shaved red cabbage...all tossed in a balanced mustard vinaigrette - was delicious! Portion was just right for lunch. I would definitely get the vegan quinoa again! Maybe with falafel on top next time, only because falafels are awesome. Hopefully they are able to make it fully free of gluten.
author: Cat T.

description: Absolutely amazing food!! By far the best customer service I've had. Jonathan was awesome! Definitely coming back !
author: Sonia Y.

description:
I came here for lunch yesterday with a group of 4. We all ordered the salads, and they were delicious! I got the kale Caesar salad with added chicken schwarma -- it was great, though the chicken schwarma is $9 for not that large of a portion. I also got the dressing on the side -- I would recommend doing this, since they seem to go a bit heavy with the dressing.

All in all, I probably won't be a regular, but I could see myself coming back for another work lunch.
author: Lillian S.

description:
What I ate: Chicken & manchego croquettes, Turkish manti, kale caesar, grilled angus beef kebab, Sousse
Visit date: January 5, 2018
First time? Yes. 

Hubs and I were celebrating so we wanted to try something fancy. He had seen Barcha on a number of occasions so we decided to stop in. On a Friday around 5:30PM they were able to seat the two of us right away without reservations.

On this visit we started with the Chicken and Manchego Croquettes and Turkish Manti. The croquettes had a perfect crunch and were packed with lots of meat. These were absolutely filling and rich, and were topped with a honey truffle topping. The Turkish manti were my favorite of the two and a little more on the lighter side. Think dumplings filled with spicy beef. Might I add the manti were beautifully plated with a drizzle of garlic yogurt and chili oil, and a sprinkling of fresh herbs and spices. I could eat a whole plate (or two) of these. 

We also had the Kale Caesar which is served with roasted beets and crumbled hard boiled eggs. It was dressed in the heavier side and I'm ok with that. Though I'm not particularly fond of having egg on my Caesar salads, it was rather satisfying. 

The show stopper though was the Grilled Angus Beef Kebab; not so much because of the flavors, but because the beef was brought to our table on a food sword and placed on our plate. The beef is served medium rare with cioppolini onions, baby yams, grilled lollipop kale, chermoula (think chimichurri but Turkish).

I'm a sucker for bourbon drinks; the Sousse was a lovely combination of Old Grand-dad bourbon, blackberries, elderflower, lemon juice, and creme de violette. It was a beautiful purple hue and very fun to drink.

Barcha has a fairly large space which is great for groups. It does get rather loud so by midway through our meal we were definitely using our clubbing voices. Also, you know it's fancy when they give you a number to claim your packaged leftovers at the maitre d's post. Barcha is that fancy.

TL;DR: If I was in the area I'd come back for drinks and appetizers.
author: Erin G.

description: Simply outstanding Mediterranean food. Amazing waitstaff. Great vibe to the place. Will definitely repeat.
author: Roger B.

description:
Delicious, fresh, and healthy food! Barcha is an amazing Mediterranean-inspired restaurant in downtown that makes the perfect stop for a business lunch. On my most recent visit, after a short wait, we were seated at the bar right in front of the open kitchen, where the food was prepared. I got to try the potato-feta croquettes and the turkish manti (spiced beef dumplings). While the croquettes were decent, the beef dumplings were irresistable--the meat was so well-seasoned, and the warm dumplings were served in a delicious garlic yogurt sauce.

For the main course, I got the chopped salad--sounds boring, but the Mediterranean flavors simply dance on your palate--the lettuce is seasoned with sumac, and there's also grapefruit, avocado, black olives, and plenty of feta. While delicious, the salad was also a bit on the salty side, due to all the briny ingredients. I also got to try a bite of the skewered lamb leg, which was amazing--the lamb was so tender and juicy and added a perfect warmth to the crunchy salad! Though expensive for what it is, Barcha offers up some delicious food in a sit-down atmosphere that's still on the more casual side.
author: David K.

description:
If you go here you must have the shakshuka! It's absolutely fantastic! Most dishes are intended for sharing so I would recommend going with a few friends. It can get a little loud on weekends so I wouldn't go here if I was looking for a quiet dinner. 
The turkish coffee ice cream is also really good.
In the past month I've already been here 3 times so it's safe to say this is my current favorite restaurant!
author: Shree K.

description:
been here a few times for lunch, dinner and drinks and it never disappoints

fresh Mediterranean style, great hummus, soups are lunch are always good. the  chef's plate at lunch is huge, like really huge. way more than once person should eat, but great to share. the shawama and skewers are all good

some interesting cocktails at HH and the bar bites are excellent

it's super crowded at lunch, definitely make reservations, although there are a few bar seats which I think are first-come, first-serve
author: Bob U.

description: This place had a really cool vibe. Definitely a fun spot to eat before a night out. We decided on ordering a few small plates instead of entree's. The octopus, lamb meatballs, & hummus w/ Turkish flatbread. Service was great, and the food was served promptly.
author: Adrina A.

description:
Came here for dinner a few weeks ago to catch up with a friend

From what I can recall, the crispy potatoes were delicious and a generous portion. Texture was great with a sauce that really brought the whole dish together

Calamari was fresh with a good char essence accompanied by a solid sauce 

Sea bass was slightly overcooked which was surprising, that aside the flavors meshed well together

The ambiance is lively with a lovely decor. Service is fast, efficient and welcoming

Overall Thoughts

I can see myself coming back again to see what else Barcha has to offer
author: Eddie W.

description: Barcha is a very pleasant location with a short but sophisticated menu.  It would be a mistake to go to Barcha and not start off with at least three Mezza selections.  Doesn't matter which ones...they're all spectacular.  That said, the Mezza portions are pretty small, so two people will make quick work of whatever is served.  Hint: the lamb meatballs are outstanding.  The entrees are excellent, but the selection is limited.  Overall, the dining room is a bit crowded and fairly noisy, but there is also an outdoor area which is better suited for casual dining and conversation on a nice day.
author: Robert A.

description:
Far superior to those gyro joints that serve up that spongy Kronos meat product.  Also, quite a lunch business scene for the FiDi.  Sure beats soup & salad somewhere generic.

Veal & Turkey Shawarma: I've never had turkey or veal in shawarma form, so decided to try both.  The rectangular cuts of meat were all crispy on the outside with tender meat below.  Though I still feel lamb shawarma is superior, the turkey/veal was fine.  Loved the fresh bread wrap and generous amount of yogurt sauce.

Crispy New Potatoes: Not as crispy as one would hope given the name.  It was more like Wrinkled-Skin New Potatoes.  I feel like 15 more minutes in the oven would have given them that nice crisp.  Also, a little bland so ended up asking for some harissa for dipping sauce.
author: Adam B.

description: I ate dinner at this restaurant tonight, and it was amazing! We ordered the Turkish manti, and chicken and manchego croquettes, which were delicious. The service is also great, the workers are very friendly. Would highly recommend this place!
author: Sofia F.

description:
i'm not familiar with Mediterranean food at all, so I think Barcha was a great first introduction for me into this cuisine! 

Located in Fidi, it was impossible to get a reservation inside the restaurant for 4 a couple of days out, so we sat outside. Waiters were super attentive with our waters and really pleasant all together.

For the appetizer, we chose the hummus. Since my coworker and I are trying to be healthy, we requested for them to switch out the bread for vegetables (which the waiter was more than happy to do so). Our hummus thus came with a side of (raw) cauliflower, carrot slices, cucumber and red peppers. I know I should be grateful that they were able to change our order at all, but I REALLY wish they would have roasted the veggies. Raw cauliflower? Icccck.

For our entree, we shared the Chef's plate with pork shawarma and grilled duck meatballs (honestly I think you can share this plate with 2-3 people). The sides included potatoes, saffron basmati (flavored rice), mixed greens and a side of bread. The meat: so so good! The duck was really tender. My colleague LOVED the potatoes - great seasoning on the potatoes. Lastly, I thought the basmati was good *only* when it was hot. Didn't appreciate the taste much after the plate cooled down.

I think I read someone's review about not needing to add any seasoning, and I completely agree! Mediterranean food has so much (unique, to me) flavor in each dish. Great for all tastebuds :)
author: Cathy C.

description: This place has very tasty food and excellent cocktails. Two of us tried 4 appetizers plus  and we were full at the end. I recommend it
author: Balu V.

description: Two words: Smoky Persian. Great presentation on this drink, coming out in a decanter with smoke swirling above the cocktail. Went for two of these plus two starters (shishito peppers and the hummus) with some coworkers. Sat outside. Service was great. Will return.
author: Michael M.

description:
Been here 5 times. Walked out once.
Decent food. 3.5 stars.
Variable wine list. 3-4 stars.
Service? Hello? Are you there? Anyone?

After a few solid visits, brought my wife. Seated & asked for service 4+ times and was ignored for 25-30 minutes and left.

Tonight - one more try. While being seated mentioned our 25 minute wait - OMG - can't wait to make up for last time we were told.

16 minute wait. Eventually Chloe and Adrianna waited on us, and they were busy but great.

Beautiful place with potential but too many other places in SF to try to come back I think.
author: Arian E.

description:
My BF and I sat at the bar and ordered some tapas and dessert.
Everything was amazing. And the whole staff is so welcoming. I found this place on yelp and so glad that I gave it a shot. I'll be back for sure.
author: Cynthia S.

description:
So so good!

Came for dinner last night with friends and had a great time. Made a reservation via open table for 7pm and when we arrived (Thurs night) it wasn't too crowded. Love the decor and warm service. Everything we ate was delicious and the ambiance and down-to-earth service made our entire meal experience great from start to finish.

We shared three apps, a salad and an entree and were satisfied but not stuffed. Started with hummus, prawns and meatballs. Hummus was amazing and smooth and the flatbread it came with was perfect. We had the kale Caesar and the kebab which is presented beautifully right off the skewer. Everything was cooked perfectly and flavors were complex but not inaccessible. 

They have lovely outdoor seating but it was a bit too cold last night for that. Not sure if they have heat lamps but would love to come back and sit outside and people watch. Great location off market street. Prices were a tad high for the entrees but the mezze were priced well (we did wish for slightly larger portions). 

Overall, a great option in this part of town and I'll definitely be back!
author: Semuteh F.

description: More 3.5 but I'll round up. It's the kind of place you take clients and coworkers to when you want to go somewhere swanky (but not *too* swanky) for lunch. As a result they are almost always packed so service is almost always a little on the slow side. While I've never been wowed by the food here (good, but not great for the price point) I find myself weirdly drawn to return every so often...
author: Rose P.

description:
Nice atmosphere, attentive service and the food was so tasty. Tried the hummus, beef potstickers and a huge chopped salad my my main. Everything was fresh and flavorful - top notch. Ended with the turkish coffee ice cream, which was just the right size to share. The crunchy cocoa nibs were a great compliment to the creamy ice cream.

If you get a chance to go, do it. May be worth making a reservation or getting there early. It can get pretty packed past 6.
author: Demi T.

description:
DANK.

I ordered the grilled angus beef kebab (pictured below) and it tasted fantastic. They even take the beef pieces off the skewer at your table as they serve you, which added to the authentic experience. Service was extremely accommodating. My only criticism is that the beef for both me and my friend were overcooked (medium to medium well) when we had asked for medium rare. 

Great experience and I'll be back!
author: Jonathan X.

description:
This place was quite intimately lit, but was still semi-casual in mood; dates, friend hangouts, and post-work dinners are all welcome here. 

First, we ordered the Turkish manti appetizer which was probably my favorite part of the meal. I never knew tomato sauce, yogurt sauce, and spices could come together to create so many different flavors. Add that on top of the beef dumplings and they're a glorious combination. It was so good that I was scraping the sauce off my plate and eating it by itself. 

Next we ordered the beef (med rare) skewer which was very juicy and had a nice bounce to it. We noticed that they didn't even offer salt on the table, because this was spiced to perfection. Nothing necessary to add. It was slightly crispy on the outside and nice and chewy on the inside.

Lastly, we ordered the egg, tomato, labneh dish with lamb (I forgot the name of the dish). The tomato was nicely sweet, but was a bit too much tomato and not enough other things Imo. The lamb sausage bits throughout the dish were my favorite parts. The egg tasted a bit plasticy too me but it might be because we left it to cook in the heat a little too long. The labneh went very well with the tomato.

Overall, very much enjoyed the dinner, but it was a bit too pricy Imo than it was worth. However, it was still a good place to try out and maybe come back to on special occasions.
author: Edmund L.

description:
1 year, 2 birthdays, and countless lunches later, this place still has not disappointed.

From the open prep-kitchen with bar seating to the outdoor area where you can enjoy the (mostly) sunny downtown San Francisco, you can always count on coming to Barcha on an empty stomach and leaving satisfied.
author: Dustin W.

description:
I don't understand the four-star reviews at all. We walked in on a Saturday night, the restaurant was about one-quarter full, which should have set off warning signs, maybe? Also, definitely a $$$ spot.

Service was fine-- the waiter made small talk and was happy to step in and out as we needed him. The mezze (shared small plates) we got were so-so, but nothing remarkable-- the duck kefta (meatballs) did not really taste like duck and chickpea falafel with labneh was okay, quite lemony. Each ran about $8-$12, but within an okay range for pricey restaurants.

The one star is for the braised lamb shoulder. When we ordered the dish, the waiter suggested we get some sides with it. We declined, thinking that a $35+ dish should have some heft to it. The dish was brought to the table in a tall, La Creuset-style Dutch oven with a place for steam in the cone-shaped lid. I wish I was kidding, but when the server lifted the lid, we had to peer over the side of the pot to see the thin layer of lamb, egg, and sauce that BARELY covered the bottom of the pot. Mind you, this was described as something that could be served family style. The taste was fine, but the portion size was a joke.
author: Nicole H.

description: I tried shakshuska (sp?) here for the first time - it was deliciously spiced and we had soft pita to sip up the sauces.  Beautiful decor, great vibe and service.
author: Lin Z.

description: The dinner menu is twice as expensive as lunch. We ordered 3 Mediterranean tapas ( meze) and it was 70 bucks with 3 beers but I have had really good meze and this place was very average in terms of taste and really meager for portion. There was cumin in hummus ... that was just not for me.
author: Sanjeeda N.

description: The Shakshuka. Why did I order this? Eggs, tomato sauce, potatoes, and some bread for $28. Maybe it is supposed to be a traditional dish, but for $28 I expected something much better. Nothing like feeling like a fool while eating my eggs, tomato, and potatoes. The brocolini was also way too saucy. The one redeeming factor was the octopus starter, but not enough to actually make me ever come back or recommend Barcha to anyone.
author: Igor V.

description: Decent lunch spot on the edge of FiDi/SOMA. Pricey for what it is, but expected for the area. Came in with a coworker, it was very busy, great outdoor seating. We shared the hummus and the large mixed plate- with grilled chicken and english pea falafel. Both were tasty, complex flavors. Also ordered a glass of house red and a glass of rose- neither were great and would avoid them next time.
author: Rhian M.

description:
This place gets packed during lunch rush hour, so if you're dining in, I suggest making reservations beforehand. Came here on a weekday for lunch around 1, and it was a full house. We were greeted and seated promptly to a well lit and spacious table. I have to give it up for their ambiance and decor - it's a step up from the other lunch spots in the area so if you have a date to impress, Barcha wouldn't be a bad choice. Their interior goes well with the Mediterranean theme, but in a more contemporary and upscale kindov way. I like.

I ordered the hummus with flatbread as an appetizer and the chopped salad as my lunch. Overall, pretty tasty! I was definitely a fan of the flatbread. It was a little oiler than I would've liked, but the sprinkle herbs and garlic made up for it. My chopped salad was also pretty good - vegetarian friendly and an added plus that it already comes with avocado. 

I was pretty satisfied with my lunch, but overall, nothing was really mind blowing about my meal. A great, fancier option for a lunch date, but there's other tastier (and cheaper) spots around the area that would've be my first choice. Their dinner menu looks pretty bomb though, so I might have to swing by a second time to give that a try.
author: Rebecca L.

description:
I came here last night with friends.  It wasn't crowded at all.  

The food was very impressive.  We had The lamb meatballs (5/5), rosemary potatoes (4/5), hummus and flatbread (4/5), the grilled duck kefta (5/5) and the crushed California avocado (4/5). Everything was super fresh, flavorful and the service was VIP.
author: Richard T.

description:
Wanted to enjoy my experience more than I did, but it was just mediocre. Nice ambiance and easy to find parking on a Sat night. Service was pretty good, but the food was a bit lacking. We decided to try a bunch of different tapas including the olives, the prawns, duck meatballs, scallops, calamari, and potato croquettes.  First of all, the olives are HOT!! Did not expect them to be so scalding... and they were SUPER salty. The prawns were also not what we were expecting (big, juicy, plum prawns) but rather quite small and regular tasting shrimp. The duck meatballs were definitely the best thing we ordered, get this! The calamari and potato croquettes were adequate, but the scallops were not good. They were ocean- bland tasting, with a very odd citrus flavor that did not mix well. We could not finish this dish.

Barcha vindicated itself in the desserts which were excellent. We got the Turkish coffee ice cream which was delicious and the dark chocolate creme was rich but good as well.

So overall, was an ok experience, probably won't return.
author: Vivian D.

description: Not a vegetarian friendly. I got a chicken in the vegetarian falafel dish and response was yes I know it happens. Even Manager could not get any better response. Won't visit this place again.
author: Kapabc a.

description: Food is decent - octopus is one of their better dishes. Drinks are $2 per serving over priced, even for happy hour. Service is usually quick and dependable but there's high turnover. While I don't go in daily, I've been there a dozen different times and haven't seen the same people twice.
author: Kevin K.

description: Fantastic! The prawns, meatballs and flat bread were fresh and delicious. We meet the owner, super sincere and good man. A little noisy, but nothing too loud or obnoxious. Highly recommend the drinks as well, smoke Persian and sousse were top notch.
author: Tandis N.

description:
Wow, some great hummus!! Their pita is super yummy (light and thin). That was the only vegan option, but it was so good I had two orders.
If you like veggie options, more choices for you, including an eggplant dish and a red pepper and walnut hummus with a poached egg! Yum.
The service was really good - high end type service, but cost was reasonable. 
Their happy hour was pretty simple, nothing extravagant......but as I think back again on the hummus........I want my 3rd order!
author: Roger C.

description:
Love this place! I've come here twice, once with a reservation and once stopped by after a barre class nearby.

The service here is fantastic. The waiters really know their food and are so helpful explaining the dishes.

The food is full of flavor, but not overwhelming.
The gem salad was very fresh, citrus-y, and a great mix of flavors with the feta cheese. 5/5
The sauteed gulf prawns was decent. Nothing that really stood out about the dish, but still over all good. 3/5
The calamari was also very fresh and citrus-y tasting. A good "summer" appetizer. 4/5
The shakshuka was unexpectedly great. Well for one, none of knew really what to expect, but it was delicious. The mix of the tomatoes and the spicy lamb shoulder sausages really hit the spot, especially on top of a side of couscous! 5/5
author: Susan Y.

description:
I often see Barcha packed for lunch, so the secret is to come for dinner. You'll be in for a real treat of flavorful dishes and a beautiful Moroccan inspired setting.

We started with a table full of tapas including the California crushed Avocado, hummus, lamb meatballs, falafel, and chicken croquettes. The California crushed avocado with an egg on top and croquettes were my favorites. I'd recommend the Kale Caesar salad as well. The dressing was perfection.

Next we enjoyed the half chicken, lamb shoulder tagine, and Persian rice. The lamb portion while tasty was on the smaller side. The rice with a crispy, golden crust and chicken with Mediterranean spices were superb. 

Barcha is a delight in SoMa!
author: Shira W.

description: Barcha is one of my favorites for a sit down lunch during the work week. I have yet to go for dinner but I'm sure I would like it just as much! The service is good and it's usually pretty easy to get a table even without a reservation although I would still recommend making one! The atmosphere is inviting but doesn't feel too cozy and they have a good amount of outdoor seating as well. I loved their feta dip, I wish they would bring that back to the menu. I've added both the chicken and lamb meatballs to my kale Caesar before, both were good but I think you might as well do the lamb here!
author: Lauren A.

description:
26th Birthday Dinner Numero Dos - As good as it gets!

Made reservations for a table of four at 7:30. We were late and they happily saved our table for us. None of us actually heard of this restaurant before and we all ended up loving it! I found it through Yelp/OpenTable trying to find a fun tapas place. I also specifically chose this place because it is next to my friends' offices but none of them ended up coming straight from the office. D'oh! My friend actually went back home and grabbed his car and was able to find street parking right outside on a Friday night so you could try your luck driving here if you want! 

Our waiter Jordan was amazing! Definitely made our dinner ten times better. Hope the manager is reading this so they can give him the props he deserves! Space is pretty big and we sat all the way in the back. Great for groups or dates! Totally made up for the subpar birthday dinner I had at Hakkasan the night before. 

We ordered a ton of tapas and everything was delicious. Standouts were definitely the shrimp, crushed avo, and arugula salad. Some of their dishes look very different than your typical ones you're used to like the tabbouleh and their patatas bravas. 

My friend ordered cognac and there was some confusion and she got some pisco instead and they happily took it back after she tasted it and didn't like it. I also got a cute dessert with a candle and everything that ended up actually being the only candle I got! Thank god for Barcha! 

I don't know why there are complaints for the high prices because it was VERY reasonable with all the food AND our 6 drinks and was the same price as dinner for four as it was for two at Hakkasan and 10x better. They have a happy hour too that I will definitely be back for!
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Came here for dinner, I had to try it since my experience at lunch was amazing! I must say, dinner was just as great! Made rvsp around 7pm and our waiter was nice and efficient, shout out to Josh (hope that was the right name)! 

We ordered:
Crushed California Avocado: Pretty good, I love the tortilla that comes with it! 
Potato & Sheep Milk Feta Croquettes: LOVE the sauce for this, a good appetizer with wine 
Grilled Duck Kefta: Delicious and juicy! I love the herbs and duck was good perfectly 
Pastrami Cured Smoked Salmon: Decent, can't go wrong with smoke salmon
California Lamb Shoulder Tagine: Yummy! Cooked very well, meat was tender and sauce was on point!
Persian Rice: Goes super well with the lamb!

Overall, great experience and quality is as great as lunch!
author: Natalie L.

description:
Great food. I went with family and we loved the variety of the menu. The service was EXCELLENT. The server was very attentive and kept checking with us with a warm smile and nice manner.
I will go back to this place next time I visit San Francisco.
author: Sara Z.

description:
Had lunch here on a Friday around 2:15. Service was excellent and they kept our water glasses full. We each ordered a sandwich, I got the classic Schwarma which was AMAZING. Perfect bread, and a great combo of turkey and veal. I got some hot sauce to dip it in and some yogurt sauce as well. 

My friend got the duck sandwich which is like ground duck made into a patty. Very tasty. Recommended.
author: Jordan C.

description: The lamb chops are to die for and the rest of the dishes were really good. Awesome! Might return this weekend for a birthday celebration.
author: Yalun X.

description:
Great food and loved the ambience of the place. I ordered the angus beef kebab with a side of diced potatoes. The kebabs were fantastic, 10/10. Cooked to perfection and full of flavor, they couldn't have been better. This being said, the potatoes were too dry, which is why I'm giving a 4 star review. 

The experience was great. The lighting gave rise to an intimate dining experience and the food was very timely prepared. Would definitely go there again.
author: Sherif N.

description:
1 weakness. The wine list. 
Now let's move on to the great menu. Go tapas and you won't be disappointed. Skip the hummus and focus on the lamb and beef dishes. The olives are tremendous. The potatoes were sooo good we just kept them coming. 
All the people around us were happy and so were we. A very nice SF find to add to Amber for our must stop places in the city.
author: David B.

description:
I think this is a hidden gem since when I came it was pretty empty - perhaps this area is dead on Sat nights?

The service is friendly and they have a nice drink selection. The food was also delicious!

We tried:

crushed CA avocado - nicely poached egg added good flavor and texture to this dish
labneh - delicious, the bread was really good
lamb meatballs - great flavor and not overly "meaty"
sauteed gulf white prawns - really fresh with flavorful red sauce 
baby spinach and sweet corn - light dressing and refreshing

It's tapas style so it's great to order a bunch of dishes and share!
author: Lillian C.

description:
We came here after work and had the grilled duck kefta, potato & sheep's milk feta croquettes, crushed California avocado and the spicy pork turnover. 

I loved the kefta and the croquettes the most because both were seasoned really well. 

Their crushed California avocado is like a super fancy, super grown up version of chips and guacamole!

I didn't really care much for the spicy pork turnover because I thought it had too much pita bread for my liking. 

For drinks, I had and loved their white sangria. The drink's presentation was awesome; orange peel garnish with a huge ice sphere inside.  It was so freaking good that I had to order two!

Our server was very attentive, knowledgeable and extremely nice! 

Very nerd like, but I felt like a Jedi waving my hand to flush the toilet! It was sooooo cool! 

Even though, I think their small plates are on the pricer side, I definitely recommend coming here to try the place out!
author: Alice X.

description: Came here for lunch with my manager to celebrate my 1 year anniversary at my job. I made reservations the day before for 11:45. We arrived and we're seated promptly. The hostess gave us the choice of inside or outside and because it was such a beautiful day I opted for outside. Once seated we decided on getting wraps. I chose the turkey schwarma wrap with a side of mixed greens while my manager chose the shrimp skewer schwarma. Both are around $17-18 each. We also started with the falafel appetizer. The appetizer came out first, 4 falafels with some onion and saladish topping. The falafel was warm and the outside crispy while the inside smooth with the pea filling. The main dish came out shortly after. It was quite delicious! I enjoyed my schwarma and was only able to eat half - I saved the other half for my dinner. I would definitely recommend this place and would totally come here again to try other dishes as well as the drinks
author: Michelle C.

description: We ordered three of the hot "mezze" dishes. Two of them were cool in the middle, and the octopus tasted weird. Wouldn't recommend Barcha.
author: Crayton M.

description: Order lamb leg sandwiches with fresh potato as side, the lamb is so dry, the potato is so salty. Service is average. After having lunch there, I have to drink a lot of water and even feel really uncomfortable because of the high sodium intake. :(
author: Rebecca L.

description:
I've been for both lunch and dinner, and would be excited to go back to Barcha for special occasions when I'm feeling a bit splurgey. Here's why...

The good: Barcha is lovely, with sumptuous French-Moroccan decor that feels both classy but comfortable, like a sexy cafe. The food is mostly delicious, with all my favorite Mediterranean flavors. Plus, the service is quite attentive and polished, so you feel well taken care of. Bonus: they offer both 3 oz and 6 oz glasses of wine, handy for lunchtime sipping. 

The not so good: portions are tiny and prices are not. This is more of a spendy spot, especially if you end up ordering lots of small mezze plates to share (at $8-10, these small bites add up). Portions could be a bit more generous for the price, I'd say. But, they are right next to Soul Cycle and Salesforce, so perhaps their clientele isn't as wallet-conscious as I am. 

Spending aside, Barcha is a lovely dining experience with an exciting menu. Ideal for a business lunch or dinner!
author: Nique F.

description: Had the salmon and some side and apps and everything was good. Great service and ambiance.
author: George T.

description:
Friendly attentive service, pleasant spacious decor, delicious Mediterranean themed modern American cuisine. This is the new sister restaurant to Sens in the Embarcadero.

I loved the grilled duck feta, the local lamb meatballs and the spicy pork turnover Mezze. The Mezze were much more interesting than the Entrees. The grilled Petra sole entree was nice but not terribly memorable.
author: David T.

description:
TLDR - trendy spot with good food and ambiance; recommend getting a bunch of tapas to share!

Love this new spot in FiDi/SOMA! Pretty trendy, lively, energetic ambiance. Good for HH, girls night, friends, coworkers, a date.. anything really. 

I'm generally a huge fan of tapas, despite the tiny portions and high prices, because I love trying a little bit of a lot of dishes, and Barcha does them pretty well. Some left more of an impression than others, but solid overall. Unfortunately, nothing was amazing enough to make me dying to come back, but I'd definitely visit again. 

I came with a reservation for 2 on a weeknight and it was pretty busy. Not sure if the reservation was needed but doesn't hurt to make one. We opted to share a bunch of tapas/mezze instead of ordering entrees:

-LOCAL LAMB MEATBALLS ($13) - 4.5/5
[tomato sauce, chickpeas, feta, mint]
Yum! The tomato sauce wasn't special but the meatballs were very tender

-GRILLED MONTEREY BAY CALAMARI ($12) - 5/5
[farro, frisée, olives, romesco]
Also yummy! The calamari was a good texture, not too chewy, and had a slight smokiness. Loved the romesco/red pepper sauce! Lots of flavors in this dish that went well together. 

-WARM RATATOUILLE ($7) - 4/5
Served with 2 pieces of Turkish flatbread, which were soft and fluffy, kind of like naan. The ratatouille was pretty good but not that spectacular.

-CRUSHED CALIFORNIA AVOCADO ($10) - 3.5/5
[poached egg, salsa verde, crispy chicken skin, pimente d'espelette]
Not bad, but this really just tasted like normal guac to me. We mixed in the egg (poached nicely with a runny yolk) but it didn't really make the guac any different. Came with 2 pieces of that amazing Turkish flatbread.

-HONEY POACHED PEARS ($10) - 3/5
[crottin cheese, ras el hanout, arugula, candied almonds]
Really sweet for an appetizer.. I would've preferred it as a dessert or with less honey. I think the cheese was supposed to help balance out the sugar but I wasn't really a fan of that kind of cheese.
author: Jessie L.
