description:
Came here 2x within a month and their food and service were both great and consistent so far.  hopefully it will continue being great. 

first time: came with a group of friends for the monthly dinner group my friend was in.  We got to try tons of different appetizers and entrees.  

my 2nd time: I came here with my brother and his girlfriend.  I did the ordering based on what I thought were delicious from the first time:
hummus: super creamy and best hummus I have ever had 
falafel: BEST EVER!!! we actually ordered another one because we all thought were delicious
lamb meat balls: We thought it was really good good 

food added this time:
Lamb shoulder: Very tender and tasty.  I just wish the portion was a little bit bigger  
rice: very tasty and delicious  we actually order another one. 
Dark chocolate ganache: very heavenly.  if you don't like sweet, you would think its very heavy.  to me, i love it  

Service: 
I just happened to have the same server both times, so both times were great 

Atmosphere: 
very cozy and lots of sitting, even outside sitting too.  Maybe when the weather is really nice, will probably sitting outside to enjoy the nice weather.
author: Candice Y.

description: This place Is gorgeous plus service and food are on point! You can easily get in and out for lunch and linger a bit longer during dinner. I've been here at least 6 times and love it more every time.
author: Amanda M.

description: The food was amazing.  The appetizers were phenomenal.  I recommend the humus and the croquettes.  The meat choices are also spot on.  I will be back to Barcha for sure.
author: Jay C.

description:
Went here for lunch on a work day. I give it four stars because of the food quality relative to price. I had the hummus as an opener which was excellent. It had robust flavor, right level of saltiness and was great to share. 

Got a falafel wrap for the main entree and it was nice. Came with the saffron rice which was a bit underwhelming. Had some raisins in it which was nice to have the sweetness. The wrap itself was nice but awfully dry. Sort of dissected it and wished there was something more moist inside it such as chopped tomato. Service was fast and clearly trying to get us out us soon as possible which made us feel a bit rushed. 

Decor is great and this is a great venue for a nice business lunch. Make sure to get reservations at least a day before!
author: Ben S.

description: If you like Spanish tapas you'll love Barcha. I've come here twice and have both times only ordered the appetizers to pair with some wine. Their meatballs, so good! I also recommend the hummus - the bread that goes with it is very addicting.
author: Vivian W.

description: Such a classy ambience ! I was in love with the decor and atmosphere the moment I stepped in   we ordered a bunch of small plates so we got to try different plates and they were pretty amazing! Has a good collection of wine too. Definitely coming back!
author: Shwetz M.

description:
2.5 STARS

I miss working in the FiDi. Lots of eye candy in suits. All they're missing is holding a pup a la Tom Hardy style. *swoons*

Seriously, is there anything better than a handsome guy and an adorable pup? Ok, maybe delicious food and booze.  

My friend and I wanted to do a pupdate so I suggested that we check out the newly opened Barcha since they have outdoor seating. Having been to their sister restaurant Sens, I kept my expectations low; other than the amazing view, the food was underwhelming. I read that Barcha's concept is casual Mediterranean so I was looking forward to having, you know...Mediterranean food. Disappointingly, the dinner menu is more New American with a touch of Mediterranean influence. For all you alkies, sorry, there's no full bar. 

Maybe we went on an off night but everything we ordered sounded good on paper and beautifully presented, except it was less than mediocre (my friend who is not picky agreed). The Mediterranean spices were absent and some of the flavor profiles just didn't work for us. 

~ * ~ F O O D ~ * ~
*Potato & Sheep Milk's Feta Croquettes w/ rouille ($8): http://bit.ly/1QQ0ow0
Crunchy, fried, plain mash potatoes but where's the cheese? We didn't taste any.

*Pastrami Smoked Salmon w/ fromage blanc, coriander honey, pickled onions ($14): http://bit.ly/1SIhs5E
Basically lox and cream cheese but nicely plated. Hard to mess up.

*Crushed California Avocado w/ poached egg, salsa verde, crispy chicken skin, piment d'espelette ($10): http://bit.ly/1I1z8TY
So enticing on paper and it looked fantastic but this was just a suped up guacamole. It was very bland, needed salt, spice, citrus, chilies, something. The yolk was decadently creamy but the whites of were still raw and jiggly. The best thing of the night was the accompanying Turkish flatbread. It was like a naan and flour tortilla hybrid--so good!

*Oven Roasted Australian Sea Bass w/ braised leeks, preserved lemon, chanterelles ($28): http://bit.ly/1Lovi7C
Crisp skin but dry and overcooked--ended up tasting like tilapia, not a rich, buttery cut of sea bass. Chanterelle sauce was more apt for a steak dish.

*Grilled Angus Shoulder Fillet w/ parsnip purée, cranberry, grilled endive, balsamic ($28): http://bit.ly/1Hb5zog
Another beautifully presented dish but the steak wasn't rested enough before slicing. It was dried out and tepid. The parsnip purée was excessively sweet and with the tart cranberry sauce, it ended up being an unappetizing pairing with the steak. 

*Walnut Baklava w/ orange blossom chantilly, spiced poached quince ($7): http://bit.ly/1PCqZ0l
Although there was a thick filling of walnuts, there were no flaky layers as the top phyllo layers were smooshed into one. Also, the walnuts were burnt.

*Dark Chocolate Ganache Tart w/ orange caramel, whipped cream fraiche, pistachios ($7): http://bit.ly/1l7OaT4 
It was rock hard and dry, like it had been sitting in the fridge for days.

~ * ~ S E R V I C E ~ * ~
I know they're new so I'm not docking them for service but adequate training is needed. I made online reservations at 5 pm. The restaurant called me the day before to confirm my reservations at 5 pm. I get there several minutes before 5 pm and was told, "We don't open until 5:30 pm". The hostess was very nice but there was no apologies for their mistake. She did agree to sit me early outside as I waited for my friend though.

My friend had a sip of her wine but didn't like it (I didn't like two of the wines I ordered but I was not about to let booze go to waste). When clearing empty plates, my friend kindly told our server she can take away her wine as well. Usually servers ask if there's anything wrong if you've barely touched your order but she didn't ask (and we didn't want to complain). We were charged for the $12 glass of wine. 

Then, came packing up our leftovers. The busboy asked what we wanted packed up and we told him the apps and the fish. He took the apps away and we never received the leftover apps. Our server then brings us a box for the fish entree. So do customers pack their own leftovers or does the restaurant?

~ * ~ A M B I A N C E / D E C O R ~ * ~
Open, bright, and airy with an open kitchen. We sat outside which had good lighting but no heat lamps. The music was loud and the selection was strange for a Mediterranean restaurant--drum & bass, techno, then salsa music? 

~ * ~ P A R K I N G ~ * ~
Easy street parking on the weekends. This is not a destination restaurant but rather a restaurant for a company paid lunch for FIDi peeps. 

After spending nearly $100 pp, we left unsatisfied and disappointed. I highly recommend heading to Kokkari instead for legit Mediterranean food or spending a little more and having a Michelin experience at Mourad. Hello, life-changing $145 short ribs!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Very yummy.  The trick is to go there on a Saturday night when the financial district is dead.

Highly recommend the Falafel.  Sounds ordinary.  It's not.
author: patrick w.

description: Nice lunch joint. Been here a couple of times. The food is consistent. Significantly and I mean significantly overpriced.
author: Amit T.

description:
I came here for lunch a couple of times. Once with a vendor who treated us and another with my wife. 

I recommend the wraps. The Chef's plate is a huge serving. I would like to go there after work and try some of their drinks.
author: Julio E.

description:
Imagine my embarrassment in getting lost trying to find this place, especially since I used to work at 425 Market for a number of years. By coincidence, I had scheduled lunch with a colleague who happens to come from the Middle East, Iran to be exact, and I thought why not try this place since Mediterranean and Middle Eastern cuisines have a lot in common. Right? After discovering that this restaurant took over the space previously occupied by Tully's Coffee and a convenience store, I was surprised how well it was transformed into a more upscale, somewhat exotic dining destination by owner Kais Bouzidi.

He also runs Sens at 4 Embarcadero, a popular happy hour spot for FiDi working drones. Sens? I was never too impressed with that spot, so the credentials didn't impress me, yet the lunch menu here did a good job of wooing my palate with a mix of mezze, salads, sandwiches and rice plates (photo: http://bit.ly/1QpNtSd). We decided to share the $6 Hummus with Cumin and Olive Oil, which was creamy and tasty and nicely complemented by the grilled Turkish flatbread that came with it (photo: http://bit.ly/1WV68tm). We both went for the $22 Chef's Plate, which granted was much higher than I usually spend on lunch, but we felt this would give us a true sampling of what they served.

My colleague decided to mix the classic shawarma of slow-roasted, free-range veal and heritage turkey with a half-dozen Grilled Wild Gulf Shrimp nestled on a bed of spicy bulgur with mixed greens and pickled onions on the side (photo: http://bit.ly/1Mhd2kD). I also went for the classic shawarma but with the Grilled Local Lamb Leg on a skewer (photo: http://bit.ly/1ONbsdL). Both the lamb and shrimp were delicious, but it was the shredded veal-turkey shawarma meat that was the standout. Both of us got even more of the grilled flatbread, still warm from the oven, with a trio of sauces - garlic yogurt, cilantro salsa verde, and harissa - on the side (photo: http://bit.ly/1X1FN7N).

Since we didn't have a reservation, we sat at the bar which gave us a bird's-eye view of the vertical rotisseries as well as the comings and goings from the kitchen. The bartender Mariah entertained us with her good cheer as she shared what the owner was envisioning for the space. I'd say Bouzidi has a hit on his hands considering how bustling business was after only three weeks in operation. I'm definitely coming back for dinner with Jamie W. even if it is a bit premium priced since they offer $6 Turkish pizza (Lahmacun) which was quite a roadside treat when I went to Turkey a few years back. Definitely a solid find.

FOOD - 4 stars...the classic shawarma is the standout item not to be missed
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...nice Turkish touches in the decor, a marked improvement over what was there before
SERVICE - 4 stars...Mariah was a peach
TOTAL - 4 stars...impressive new Mediterranean spot may not be completely authentic but it doesn't lack for big flavors.
author: Ed U.

description: I took my friend here to celebrate her Birthday. Our reservation was at 6:30pm, it was packed. I heard amazing things about this place. The ambiance was beautiful and the staff was very professional and friendly. Everything we ordered was very tasty. We had the Turkish manti, potato and feta croquettes, summer ratatouille, pan seared white sea bass, and a delicious dessert for the birthday girl. I truly enjoyed my experience and can't wait to bring more people!
author: Wanda V.

description: Surprisingly delicious. Simple presentations and bold flavors. House made flatbreads and hummus were standout, squid salad with cara cara & olive excellent. Duck Kefta & Merguez Sausages were both really well seasoned and not over cooked. Prompt friendly service, Moroccan mint tea is a winner.
author: Gary FX L.

description: Amazing food, service. Overall a great experience. We order different plates to share and everything was superb. We loved the octopus, the shrimp, manchego and chicken croquettes. Don't forget about cocktails and dessert that are great too.
author: K C.

description:
I went here for lunch today. The interior is nice and the place is busy and noisy. But it's to be expected in the FiDi for lunch. 
I had the shawarma sandwich which was good, nothing exceptional. Having live in Detroit which has limitless shawarma places I am used to there being pickles in the sandwich. They were on the side here and not enough to make it through the sandwich with each bite, so that was disappointing.
The price is over priced but I knew that when choosing lunch place.
All in all an okay place I would give it 3.5 stars but no half stars in review. I downgraded instead of up on the basis, I saw the humus plate (bowl) was 8.00, way overpriced.
author: Micheal M.

description: Very unprofessional restaurant I called on Friday to make a dinner reservation for a party of 16 people the following week and was told on the phone that this would be taken care of.  I call back on Monday to confirm the reservation and the man I spoke with on the phone said there is nothing reserved under my name and for that size.  He promised I would receive a call back by end of business day to confirm my reservation and I received no call back.  I don't recommend this place.
author: Stephanie I.

description:
Went to Barcha with the four of us. Did two rounds of four 'mezze' dishes and shared that between us. The size of the dishes fitted this nicely. Each and every dish tasted wonderfull. Flavours were outspoken but never to strong.
Ambiance is modern and very nice though a little bit noisy. Service was good.
My wife and i return to Europe but the the others in the party certainly will come back.
author: Gert-Jan V.

description: There was literally a rock in my rice that I almost cracked my tooth on. Pretty sure that shouldn't be there.
author: Jayson H.

description: Nice clean sleek ambience. Good location in downtown. Really good appetizers. Entrees were so-so. Will eat here again though. Upscale Mediterranean food. Entrees in the high 20s - 30s.
author: Gloria T.

description:
We tried to go to Tender Greens but there was a line around the block at 11:50am on a Wed.  We were celebrating a co-worker's departure, so we had to make a quick call. This restaurant is right next door to Tender Greens and it had room via a recent cancelation, the posted menu outside looked tasty too.

5 of the gals got the same salad with different proteins. I got the pork sandwich which came with a side (I chose the crispy roasted potatoes.) 

We split the hummus appetizer which was good - but small. 

Note that if you get refill of soda they DO charge you $3/per, so watch out!

My sandwich was really good and a bit messy. It came with a side of yogurt and a side of (presumably home-made) hot sauce.  The bread was thinner and chewier than pita, and was a nice alternative (probably more fattening too)  

The bill for 5 people (and we treated the 6th gal) was $32 including tip - so NOT a cheap lunch - but you could do it cheaper with no sodas and salads without the proteins added. It was a beautiful day and they do have outside seating - so get there early (or make a reservation) if you want to be seated outside.
author: Amy W.

description: Love this spot, nice location, great vibe. I had SHAKSHUKA and GATEAU BASQUE as desert and it's amazing! Will have to go back again.
author: Christina Y.

description: Located in the financial district, this place is good for group luncheons and dinners. They have good cocktails!
author: Hemant J.

description: This place Has a nice ambiance, friendly service but the food is decent and way overpriced.
author: Karo G.

description:
Pros:
- Wide range of mediterranean cuisine. 
- Persian rice and grilled kebab are specialties. Humus platter is also a great appetizer.
- Went their twice and had great service both times! 

Cons:
- There are vegetarian options, but they definitely aren't the speciality and aren't as filling.
author: Abhi M.

description: Excellent food and service. Surprised after walking around for so long in the financial district and finding an almost empty restaurant. After we came in , then people started filling up. All the food had very nice presentation and they all taste delicious. Especially liked the kale Caesar salad and the steak entree. bravo!
author: Elysa T.

description:
I'll always remember my dinner at Barcha. Really, how could i forget the $8 sparkling water. Great ambiance with a Moroccan flare to the interior design as well as the menu. As other reviewers have stated, trying to find dinner in the financial district is tough because everything closes pretty early in an area where most of us are working pretty late. Barcha fit the bill for my paleo palate plus had the cute factor since I was taking a client to dinner.  

We ordered the lamb kebab family style, ratatouille, and new potatoes for him. While expensive, the portions were substantial and I felt satisfied by our meal - they do not skimp in serving size or flavor. I had a glass of the house chardonnay and the flavors were charming together - truly, our meal was excellent. We had a server from England who you can tell serves as a career and he was a conversationalist with an attention to detail and presentation. I believe the client (coming from the east coast) was impressed by his entire experience, dinner at Barcha included!
author: Elizabeth V.

description:
I had a salad and a cherry lemonade. Delicious.

Two co-workers and I came around lunchtime and the only available seating was outside. It ended up being comfortable because of the cover overhead (it was sprinkling in SF that day). I liked it so much I planned a HH for my team there next week. I hope it goes well!
author: Jazmyn W.

description: The only downside was the noise level, it is a little too loud.  But the food itself was very good.  The Lamb Meatballs and Hummus appetizers were exactly what we were looking for.  The Kale salad is also good, but you need to like kale (a lot!).  Worth the trip from Union Square in my opinion.
author: David C.

description: Yummy Mediterranean food. Super busy as it's conveniently located by Salesforce. Make a reservation and if you're flexible with seating (indoor, counter...) you will be good. Their hummus is tasty and salad with chicken is filling.
author: Laura D.

description:
So was in the city to head into the office for once and was meeting up with a friend for lunch and decided on this spot as it was "new" to me and someplace she had not tried as well. We made a reservation at 11:30 and made our way over to beat the lunch rush. We were greeted promptly and brought over to our table with menus in hand. We were sitting next to a coatrack making it easy to hang up our jackets. The joint itself is a clean layout with it being a "long restaurant". The inside of the restaurant has an open kitchen along the side and tables filling all the middle of the joint. 

After being seated, decided to grab the hummus as an appetizer and I decided to get the shawarma sandwich as my main entrée. The food came out quickly with the service being efficient throughout the entire meal with water refills coming quickly. The hummus came out first of course and it was the perfect texture and paired well with the flatbread. This had a solid flavor to it and I was a fan of it. The shawarma came out next. The meat was cooked really well and pretty flavorful which was nice. I didn't leave any of it left on the table as it was just plain delicious. I was happy with my choice and my friend decided to order a salad which she said was equally good. 

This was a solid lunch spot and we were both pleased with this being an option within walking distance of our office on Mission & 2nd. Definitely a spot I will check out more in the future to try other things and happy to see it open.
author: Dan M.

description: This place is a gem. Had dinner at Barcha last night with my daughter. This is the second time I have eaten there. The first time was the first year it opened, and the food & service is still fantastic. It is located in the financial district so it appears to be quieter on Saturdays than during the weekdays. It is a great option instead of going to the trendy restaurants in Union Square if you are looking for a great meal. I saw the earlier review about a salad. I can't speak to that, but the starters and main entrées are fabulous. I definitely need to come back more often when I'm in the City.
author: Janice F.

description: Wonderful ambiance and great tasting food! If you are looking for a good lunch spot in the financial district I would highly recommend this place!
author: Andrea H.

description: This restaurant absolutely stood out in my Mediterranean choices at SF. Delicious food, friendly staff and cool place to grab food with friends and family.
author: Sriharish K.

description:
Trying to find a dinner restaurant in the financial district on a Saturday is rough. But Barcha should be at the top of your list.  Great Mediterranean options that can cater well to carnivores, vegetarians, and vegans alike. 

Start with one of the housemade cocktails.  The Perpignan is a personal favorite but the Marbella was good as well.  Move on to shareable appetizers. Always ask the servers recommendation, but you should definitely include the homemade sausage (or the lamb meatballs if lamb is more your thing).

I was going for a light dinner so I capped it all off with just a salad but the portion was large enough to serve as a good dinner entree. The kale Caesar salad with golden beets was absolutely delicious - and highly recommended! If you'd like to add some protein to that just let them know and they can add a chicken or lamb skewer. 

I glanced at the dessert menu, but decided to call it quits. Have to save something for the next time...
author: Ryan B.

description: I'm not normally a fan of Mediterranean food, but the salads here have impressed me every time. I'm not vegetarian, but the vegan quinoa salad was out of this world! The meats, on the other hand, in my friend's combo platter were dry - yuck.
author: B. Y.

description:
Great place, good ambience, close to Bart, even good food. 

Experience: WORST SO FAR, booked a table way in advance, as in days in advace and some members were running late and we were told that we need to out by a certain time as they were busy. Keep in mind our bill was upwards of $300, so its not like we were not spending. Plus we already ordered food / drinks to keep the tap running. 

Icing on the cake the waiter was really rude, I asked him for tea recommendations as I had sore throat and the guy said, "I'm not a doctor". Well duh, you wont be working as a waiter if you were, I didn't say this to the waiter as I was there on business meeting. Then it took 3 times for him to get my drink right. 

Overall, if you are willing to look over the service then this is good place to eat. Keep in mind they are not doing anything out of ordinary.
author: Akhil M.

description:
I was excited to find a good tapas place & looked forward to having dinner here.  We did make a reservation for Saturday night (same as the big fight).  When you make your reservations, a high-top are tables in the center of the restaurant. Since there wasn't a lot of people there, they accommodated us with a seat at the bar.

Let's go with the good stuff first.

The atmosphere is every inviting for a date night.  I loved how cozy & warm it felt.  Knowing we wanted some wine, the manager gave us a taste of 2 very affordable nice wines (our bottle cost $50).  This was GREAT. Never had been somewhere & asked for a recommendation of wines & the host get exactly what we enjoy right off of the get-go.

We started with the AUGULA AND ENDIVE salad.  This is big enough for two to share & the flavors were great.  Both of us enjoyed the salad very much.

Next was the SAUTÉED GULF WHITE PRAWNS with BAZLAMA.  The shrimp were in a bed of tomato sauce with white wine & this was extremely savory.  HIGHLY recommend this dish.

Now for the bad...

Not long after we sat down the bartender asked what we wanted to drink.  Said we wanted to start with some water & asked for a recommendation of wine.  Here is where the manager gave us the wonderful recommendation.  After we got the wine, the bartender immediately asked if we were ready to order (no we haven't received our wine yet) or needed a couple of minutes.  We have literally been here maybe a total of 5 minutes.  We get our bottle of wine opened, said our cheers & we were asked again if we were ready to order.  Feeling like we were being pushed, the bartender said the kitchen is closing at 9 tonight.  Our reservation was for 8:30pm & absolutely nothing was said until NOW, they were closing early.  So... for this reason, I gave them a low rating.  

Don't make customers feel like they are not wanted.  When you see a reservation is made & you know the kitchen is closing early, call the customer & let them know.  I felt like I was on my work lunch hour & had to keep track of the time.  We were in & out in 30 mins.  Not the greatest way to end the night.
author: Tammy H.

description:
This restaurant is simply amazing. It has great food, an awesome drink/Happy Hour menu, classy ambience and above all and extremely likable and friendly staff. 

I love the happy hours here - if you're looking for a great place for delicious lunch, or even a nice quiet sit down dinner with the family, Jonathan and his staff will make sure you're well taken care of. 

Lunch delicacy - Lamb Shwarma + crispy potato side. This is an exceptionally done item. Nothing less than 5 Stars!!

Dinner - can't go wrong with the beef kebab 

Drinks - They have Duvel on tap!
author: Harneet G.

description: Great ambience, good food and drinks. Tried most of the dishes on the small plate menu and hummus was the best. Lamb meatballs, grilled octopus and prawns were also good.  Ratatouille from side dish menu was great.
author: Rohit G.

description:
This place is located in the Fidi, just a few blocks from the ferry building. If you're planning to go for lunch, I recommend you make a reservation as this place fills up pretty quickly due to the all the office buildings nearby. They have both indoor and outdoor seating, which are both super nice! Our server was very attentive and helpful with suggestions on what to order. 
We got:
Turkish manti - comes with 3 to an order. Loved it! Super moist and very flavorful!
Chicken and manchego croquettes - Delicious! I recommend this!
Arugula and heirloom chicories salad - topped with blue cheese and hazelnuts. Great texture and flavor. I'm not much of a salad person but I enjoyed this! We added shrimp.
Chef's plate - you get a choice of one skewer and one shawarma and it comes with crispy potatoes, basmati rice, and mixed baby greens. We choose the slow roasted spicy pork and grilled local lamb leg. The meats were on the bland side and needed more seasoning. Potatoes weren't very crispy. This was just okay. 
Overall, I'd recommend this place!
author: Cindy N.

description:
*** In Short ***

Trendy Mediterranean restaurant serving up okay tapas, but excellent drinks.

*** In Depth ***

Meeting up with a good friend for dinner several months ago, I decided to, for once, leave the choice of venue up to someone else. Barcha was suggested, and along we came, after a bit of searching, due to all the construction in the area. We ate:

Crushed California Avocado - Basically a fancy guac dish: flavorful and a bit tangy, but just okay overall.

Sauteed Gulf White Prawns - Giant prawns that were perfectly cooked, but, unlike the avocado appetizer, these weren't as flavorful, and the flavor it did have was not particularly noteworthy.

California Lamb Shoulder Tagine - By far the best dish of the night, with both good flavor and a nice, fork-tender texture.

Ghost Chile Drink - Not a dish, but both my friend and my drinks were the highlight of our meals. This one, in particular, was excellent, with some great flavors, a bit of smokiness, and a solid kick to it.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Huge venue with plenty of space to maneuver about, and plenty of accessible seating.

Bathroom - Didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description: I came here for an anniversary and had such a great experience! Our server Monica was great and they really took care of us. The small plates are wonderful and every single thing we had we would order again. Thanks Barcha!
author: Adam R.

description:
Dinner started off great at first.....

Manager and staff were attentive and friendly. We ordered the octopus (not bad), croquettas (definitely yummy), yellowfin (meh, no flavor), and Shaksuhka with basmati rice -- only thing was we NEVER got our Shaksuhka with rice, because our waitress forgot we ordered a main dish!!! Who does that????? The funny thing was she stopped by our table to ask if we wanted water or more wine and then asked if we wanted dessert....which then I reminded her that obviously we didn't want dessert because we've been waiting for our entree this entire time!!! She then awkwardly told us oh yes that's coming right now, hmmm?! suspect right?! Why the heck would we order dessert before we get our entree??? Anyways, we told her to forget the Shaksuhka -- just like you forget our order. We were both over it at the moment and hangry. Sadly, we did not get an apology for forgetting our entree and the waitress clearly did not acknowledge her mistake. No more barcha for us, everyone else skip this joint and head elsewhere for your dining experience unless u want to end up Hangry!
author: Julia K.

description:
I love the ambiance at this restaurant. Good location for dinner after work if you work in Financial District. The service was great. Waiter was very attentive and checked up a good amount of times.  My friend and I got the following items: 

Persian Rice: Definitely recommend getting this with the ratatouille. If you are familiar with indian food it tastes like Jeera rice but a little more flavorful. 

Ratatouille: This is definitely a must get! So flavorful and tasty. It is a little sweet but a good amount of sweet to enjoy the taste. It is served with flatbread and I would highly recommend to get the Persian rice to eat along with it. Out of all the items this is definitely my favorite as a big entrée dish. Good to share with one person. 

Cous Cous: My least favorite item. My friend and I could barely finish it because it tasted so dry and there wasn't much flavor to it. It is different from the other cous cous I tasted which is more moist and has more spices. This one was very bland. 

Potato Feta Croquettes: MUST get. Great side and absolutely delicious!!! I lost my phone on this night so I can't post the picture but so yummy I would definitely recommend. 

My friend and I also shared cabernet together - their wine collection is great. I tried the Greek and Turkish and I enjoyed it. Overall, great place to dine after work and good for small entrees/tapas.
author: Tulsi M.

description: Love this lunch spot close to work for delicious food n ambience.  Plus you cannot go wrong with service here.  My favorite is Orzo pasta salad with grilled lamb shawarma.
author: Chet M.

description: My 3rd time there with an important guests in a setting. The staff was very accommodating during a busy lunch rush. Price is decent to high. Food is always good. Close to Bart. Just need to reserve in advance. Gets booked for lunch quite quickly.
author: A Z.

description:
Giving Barcha 5 stars because of the awesome service. Mario went out of his way to make sure I felt comfortable and taken care of as I waited for my friend to arrive. From there, he provided attentive, kind service throughout the remainder of the meal. I was very, very impressed by him.

The food, atmosphere and location were great too! I especially enjoyed the salmon appetizer.
author: Hannah P.

description:
These are my favorite reviews to write. Why? Because I came here with zero knowledge about the place and no expectations, and I was totally blown away by my experience. Barcha is hands-down one of the better FiDi/SOMA lunch spots to emerge in the past year. 

The restaurant is quite massive, and yet there's still a long line at the hostess desk to snag a table. That's how popular this place is! My advice would be to make a reservation in advance. Keep in mind, this isn't your usual fast-casual joint. You're not ordering food at a counter and waiting for your number to be called. This is a legit restaurant with servers and a first-class kitchen cranking out top-notch Mediterranean cuisine.

Although my lunch companion and I hadn't reserved a table, they were kind enough to seat us at the bar near the kitchen. I was delighted to see that they had a full bar, so I ordered one of their specialty cocktails - the Istanbul (a plum-infused bourbon cocktail with orange bitters and served over a giant ice cube). It was a like a Mediterranean twist on an Old Fashioned. I loved it. Could've slurped down 2 more of these bad boys if I didn't have to go back to the office.

For my entree, I ordered the Shawarma made with slow roasted free-range veal and Heritage Turkey. The succulent meat is served in housemade turkish bread with lettuce, tomato, onions and your choice of green salad or rice (I went with the salad). If you order this dish and like a little extra heat/kick, then be sure to ask for the paprika aïoli and cilantro salsa verde on the side. I've never had a Shawarma so delicious before. All the ingredients were fresh, and the dish was beautifully plated. Best of all, it only took 5 minutes for us to get our meal (and this was in the middle of their busy lunch hour!). Unbelievable!

Ok, I'll admit... the Shawarma wasn't exactly cheap. It was $18. But you could easily eat half of your meal and be full and then take home the rest of it for dinner later that night. So as far as I'm concerned, you're getting two delicious meals for $18, and that seems like a fair price to me!

This restaurant really has an undeniable lively vibe. The decor is sleek and sexy (sort of neo-Mediterranean), the service is friendly and attentive, and I just felt cool for hanging out here.

If you're looking to impress a client or just grab a biz-casual bite to eat with friends or co-workers, I would definitely put Barcha on your SOMA/FiDi lunchtime radar!
author: Kevin B.

description:
Loved it!

The cocktails were innovative and bold.  The favors of each and every dish were succulent, spicy, rich, and lasting.  The service was excellent without any air of pompousness.  The decor was sexy and playful.  

I only wish it was in Napa Valley so I could go every week!  In fact, I'd love to chat with the owner about if they would consider a third restaurant up here!
author: Leigh H.

description:
Came here for a work lunch in the middle of Salesforce conference and was still able to get a seat! Although we called a couple hours ahead of time to get reservation for 12:45PM for 2 people. When we arrived, we only had to wait a few minutes before our table was ready. 

I had the LAMB SHAWARMA and it was delicious! The lamb was well marinated and very tender. I only wish they served the wrap in a paper or something else because it was messy to eat with hands. Although I wanted to be healthy and get the mixed greens as my complimentary side, I went with the ROASTED POTATOES and totally did not regret my choice! The potatoes were perfectly salted and seasoned with rosemary, with extra crispy edges and fluffy interior. My supervisor got the SAFFRON RICE as her side and it was also very flavorful. 

For drinks, we had the MINT LEMONADE and MINT ICED TEA...both very refreshing. 

Service was attentive and we got our food pretty quickly while in the middle of a busy lunch rush.

I'd come here again for a nice lunch in the FiDi.
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
We were visiting the city today and were in the mood for Mediterranean. So we decided to try out Barcha after reading its great reviews on Yelp. And boy, am I glad we chose this place. 

The place was almost fully packed at lunch time, but we were quickly seated outside. The place has a lot of tables outside and is nicely set up. 

We started off with the chicken croquettes and they were pretty decent. The highlight of the menu though was the Chef's plate. My friend and I split it and we liked every item in it. The shawarma with the turkey and veal was SO delicious that I had to fight my friend for the last few pieces. The saffron rice was really flavorful and accompanied the shawarma well. Top it off with the garlic yogurt and the meal was on point. We also liked the crispy potatoes, the gulf shrimp, the Turkish flatbread and the hummus. 

The customer service was great and everything came to the table within a few minutes of ordering. 

Ambience - 5 stars. Service - 5 stars. Food - 4.5 stars. 

I definitely recommend this place for lunch.
author: Swathi R.

description: Decent Mediterranean food in the Financial District.  Our server was a bit distracted and brought us a bill with a $75 charge for a bottle of wine we didn't order. She fixed it quickly once I brought this to her attention.
author: Dingus M.

description:
A little pricey, but good. We came here for a friend's birthday and did it tapas style (4 or 5) and shared an entree between 5 people. The food and service were really good. I think the best part though is the ambiance. I love the big lamps hanging from the ceiling.

Would definitely come again!
author: Fahren F.

description: Outstanding visit.   We did a ton of small plates.  Stand outs were.  Potato croquettes with feta.  Prawns.  Spiced beef pockets.   Avocado dish with egg.   Calamari.  On dessert.   Backlava was amazing as was the chocolate pot.  The only thing I would say was that our waiter was not very personable and did not really engage or help us in any way.  Seemed more fast food like and the prices are certainly not fast food
author: Clare W.

description:
Awesome food y'all; don't miss out!

I came into Barcha with 5 of my co workers and we couldn't have been more pleased with our experience, especially the food.

We shared:

Hummus: 5 out of 5 (AMAZING - you'll definitely need at least 2 orders for every 2-3 people)
Ratatouille: 5 out of 5
Lamb Meatballs: 5 out of 5 (so yummy)
Grilled Calamari: 5 out of 5 (cooked perfectly)
Beef Tartare: 5 out of 5
Shishito Peppers: 3 out of 5 (I felt they were lacking flavor)
Kale salad: 5 out of 5
Radicchio salad: 4 out of 5 (slightly over dressed)
Shamuka (spelled wrong I think): 5 out of 5 (HOLY CRAP, so good!)
Grilled Half Chicken: 3 out of 5 (not bad)
Swordfish: 5 out of 5 (delicious!)

I also recommend the Lebanese Cabernet Sauvignon for you red wine lovers!

Barcha is definitely worth checking out!
author: Laura B.

description:
MAKE A RESERVATION!! It's worth it. 

We walked in on a Wednesday around noon for lunch, every table was reserved, but we were able to sit right away at the bar. 

If you're craving Mediterranean in the city, this is the place. The food is delicious! It's refreshing and fulfilling. You must order the falafel, hummus, & quinoa salad. The falafel was my favorite. The appetizer portions are "small plates" but you can easily share multiple items. The salad was huge, and sandwiches looked full sized. 

Great location & fun atmosphere. It's very social here, so bring your friends or come meet a new one!
author: Diem N.

description:
Dinner review - Saturday night.

Food: 2/5
Service: 2/5
Ambiance: 3/5

I'm honestly disappointed! It looked so promising, plus it is only a few blocks from my bf's place so I was really hopeful to add a great restaurant to our list.  We had reservations Saturday night at 8:30pm, walked and the place was about half full.  

We sat down and was greeted by the waitress, she was nice.  We ordered a few appetizers, the shishito peppers, gulf shrimp, tuna and the olives.  Everything was a bit under seasoned, the tuna didn't seemed fresh. Nothing really stood out.  We waited a long time for the shrimp to come out, and by this time they had already cleared our small plates, so when the shrimp came out, I asked for some and she never brought them over.  Our waitress also never came back to take our entree order and I had to remind her.   Several times my bf's water glass was empty and had to wait a long time for them to refill them.  

I honestly don't know if they were just having an off night or what, but I seriously don't understand why this place is so highly rated...the food was below average and service was terrible and prices were moderately high for the quality of food we got.  My bf is usually very generous and more forgiving than I am but he even said he didn't tip her well, and that is saying a lot.  Definitely will not  be returning. Glad others are having a better experience thought :)
author: Inha L.

description: Underwhelming experience. Though service was friendly enough, timings were way off. Our first drinks were brought out ten minutes apart from each other, and there was a gap of nearly an hour between starters and mains due to a large party arriving. We were also brought other tables' dishes twice, had to remind the waiter of our order twice, and had an incorrectly priced drink show up on our bill. As for the food: we liked the dips and dumplings we had for starters, but our main of stuffed aubergine rolls was not worth the hefty price tag (close to 30 bucks for a smallish vegetarian dish). The aubergine was undercooked and chewy and the filling of grains and goat's cheese was mushy, bland baby food. Despite the place's lively vibe, I won't be going back.
author: Coline S.

description:
I was in a scramble to make dinner reservations for a large party and found Barcha on Opentable, and the yelp reviews seemed promising.

What a spectacular meal! We showed up a little late, and added two to our party at the last minute, and the servers/hostess said it was no big deal. Phew. 

The crushed Californian avocado was incredible. A must order item. Comes with piping hot flatbread that's equally divine (ask for more, trust me on that one). The Croquettes were divine, the prawns are also a MUST order item. Local lamb meatballs are also delicious. Of the entrees, I would recommend the lamb shoulder, it was, so so so good. The sole was also incredibly tender. I'd come back. 

This place is right on the verge of getting popular!
author: Shu Jin S.

description:
Enjoyed a tasty weekday business lunch at Barcha. Overall, a great option for lunch just make sure you inform your server.

Food: 4 stars. I ordered the Chef's plate Shawarma enabling me to sample many lunch items. I chose the classic turkey with lamb skewers. The lamb tasted great not rough at all. The turkey was also flavorful. The mixed salad on the side with rice also had great flavors.

Service: 4 stars. They might need to look at increasing staffing during the lunch time shift. There was one waiter for all outside tables. It took our table a bit of effort to get the check and complete our orders.
author: Jessica C.

description: Not a bad place for lunch (ordered hummus and a lamb wrap, both good), but I wish some of their dinner options could be made available. It's mostly sandwiches and quick plates during the day. On the pricier side. Service was brisk.
author: Jen K.

description:
I was starving after work last Friday so one of my best friends and I decided to grab something to eat at Barcha.  The place is simply and elegantly decorated. We stepped in without a reservation and the owner greeted us warmly and provided us with a table right next to the bar area. 

I ordered the mint iced tea and my friend ordered the sangria for drinks. 
We wanted to stick with small bites so we ordered the following items: 

Patatas Brava: garlic, paprika, meyer lemon aioli, spicy tomato sauce

Hummus:  cumin, olive oil, grilled turkish flatbread

Potato & Sheep's Milk Feta Croquettes: paprika aioli

Argula & Endive Salad: medjool dates, dried apricots, point reyes blue, candied almonds, honey vinaigrette this was delicious!  I loved the dates 

Service was great.  Not too intrusive and they were there to clear our plates as soon as they were empty.   I will definitely return and check out the place for lunch soon.  Definitely recommend.
author: Christine P.

description:
I'm not an usual fan of Mediterranean but this place completely changed my mind. I'm now a Mediterranean food convert.  My friend and I ordered 3 of their tapas, an arugula salad, and wine. We weren't sure how big the dishes were going to be, so we tried everything that stood out to us.

Food:
Hummus, $7
Local Lamb Meatballs, $13
Potato & Sheep Milk Feta Croquettes, $8
Arugula Salad, $13 
House Red Wine, $8 
House White Wine, $8
Total including Tip/Tax: ~78

All of the dishes were yummy, everything was flavorful and had just the right amount of seasoning. However, my favorites include the croquettes and the arugula salad. I could literally eat croquettes all day, every day. The arugula salad was also great; I loved the dried apricots and dates.

Service: All the workers were attentive and gave great customer service. Our server continuously checked up on us and our water glasses were never empty. As we were leaving, literally all the employees who we encountered thanked us for visiting and wished us a great day. Such a small gesture, but it makes me want to go back. 

Atmosphere: The interior has chic decor with a rustic feel. I visited on a Thursday night and it was packed; definitely not a quiet restaurant. It's loud, but just the right amount of loud. I'd say this place would be great for a first date or even a night out for dinner with girlfriends.
author: Stefany Z.

description:
Great food, great service. Stick to the appetizers/sides, as the entrees are expensive and small. Two of us shared the falafel, hummus, peppers, chopped salad (vegetarian), and grilled corn, and I'd recommend every one of them. I've had a lot of falafel and this was arguably the best. Served in 4 discs, not balls, it was very moist without any hint of being oily. The presentation was more elevated than what you likely imagine for a falafel plate. The Turkish flatbread served with the hummus was fantastic. The dishes' spices such as dukka and marash pepper provided an interesting twist to what might otherwise be standard peppers and corn. 5 dishes for the two of us was a good amount; I probably could have comfortably fit in half a dessert if cajoled. Finally, the cocktails were very well made with interesting ingredients, although the portions quite small, especially considering standard fidi cocktail prices.

The interior was surprisingly casual, but still nice enough to take a date. On a Saturday night, the place was nearly empty, as are most spots in the area on weekends. I'm sure for happy hour during the week the place is poppin and I'd love to come back then.
author: Cristina S.

description:
Thank you Barcha! After living in the Bay Area for over 15 years I am very happy and excited to say that there is FINALLY somewhere I can go to have a real delicious shawarma sandwich. In fact, I must say that it is even better than those I've had in other countries I've travelled to...

Unlike every other shawarma spot I've been to in the bay which I find to be unauthentic and "Americanized" , the one I had at Barcha was the real deal: smaller in size and so delicate and flavorful. For one, I could tell for sure that the ingredients were very fresh and high quality. Also, I was told by our server after we finished our meal that the flatbread is make fresh in house. The two sauces served on the side were excellent, the hot sauce wasn't so hot but still very tasty. 

All in all , I very impressed with this new restaurant. My friend ordered the chefs plate which looked very good , and she was also very pleased with her meal. The only issue we had was that it was very busy and even though we had a reservation they apparently had some difficulty managing it. I'm sure this is because they have recently opened and hopefully this will be fixed soon so they can handle more reservations. Either way I'm definitely looking forward to coming back and trying some of the other nice looking meats they had on the rotisserie and grill.
author: Rumi R.

description:
Ordered their "Classic" Shawarma to go during lunch. Good quality. Fast and Friendly Service.

The Shawarma (made with Veal and Turkey) was skimpy and underwhelming. I will say their house made Turkish bread wrap is very good...but I'm not ordering a Shawarma for the bread. After I finished, I felt like going to get a real one elsewhere because it didn't satisfy my craving. Maybe I caught them on a bad day.

Glad I finally tried Barcha but there are better lunch options in the area.
Based on the quality, I'll be back during dinner to try the small plates.
author: Zoran L.

description:
I've walked past Barcha many times and finally found an opportunity to try it out for lunch. Once I saw the prices, I was happy that I didn't have to pay.

I had a very delicious slow roasted Berkshire rosemary pork ($17) for lunch. The meat was flavorful and tender and the portion size was just right.

The only thing I did not like about the restaurant is the tight row of two-top tables down the middle, where we sat. I understand that it's important to maximize the use of space but it felt cramped and uncomfortable.
author: Yi Z.

description:
I made the reservation at Barcha before finding out from the other Yelp reviews that Barcha is a sister restaurant of Sens.  I'd been to Sens a few times but their dishes were always subpar.  So after giving Sens one last chance thinking it will get better but sadly they never did and I have not gone back ever since.  Nonetheless I decided to give Barcha a try because their baklava looked so good on the Yelp pictures.  

The inside of the restaurant is fairly roomy but they packed the tables so close to each other, we were competing our conversations with the tables next to us.  Since everyone had to talk over each other, the restaurant gets very loud.

Ordered the chef's plate with our choice of duck and the waiter's recommendation of lamb skewer, the house smoked salmon apps, baklava, and chocolate ganache for dessert.  The duck cost extra but the waiter failed to inform us when he told us to pick out two choices of meat.

Food was unexpectedly excellent,  the chef's plate was colorful and the veggies looked shinny green and fresh.  Meat was tender and flavorful.  Baklava was packed with nuts though can use a little bit more honey as it seems to be a little bit on the dry side, and the ganache was smooth and creamy, but a bit heavy for me since I am not a big fan of chocolate so I only tried a spoonful.  

It's a nice go to lunch place and will return.
author: Shirley H.

description:
Food: You know the food is good when you can't concentrate on anything else but the flavors in your mouth. I ordered the ratatouille and was overwhelmed with how delicious it is. I am a big fan of Mediterranean food and this was certainly one of the best I've been to! I can't stress how amazing the food was enough. My friend ordered a meat dish which he also raved about. I wasn't able to try since I'm a vegetarian but it seems to be a great place for meat-eaters and vegetarians. 

Ambiance: Stunning details and décor. It was a warm-feeling place, perfect for a spring/summer midday lunch. Great for a casual date, business meeting, or meeting up with friends. It is the sort of place that will brighten your mood...perhaps the nice wine and good company also had a role in that. 

It is one of my favorite restaurants. 100% recommend.
author: Anya R.

description: First  time here, and we went with friends that had been before so they had some recos. All in all it was "ok". The Turkish wine was nice, but that was about it. The AC was SOOOO cold it made our food cold, and we were freezing at times, hence 3 stars. We ordered: hummus (this was nice because it had some whole ceci but overall is was just ok), chopped salad (I unfortunately got to this after my friends had eaten most so it was just ok. And this is ONLY based on the dressing.), Turkish manti (I didn't eat these as I'm a pescatarian but my husband did not care for these), grilled calamari (these were VERY good but there was not enough on the plate), and potato & feta croquettes (These were so-so. So little feta you wouldn't know there was any in there.). Interior is nice but it is WAY too loud, and they have to turn down the AC (it was not hot out)!!
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Some coworkers and I had dinner here not too long ago.  We had reservations, arrived right on-time and somehow still waited about 10 min in what seemed to be an empty restaurant. 

When we were seated, we immediately ordered and shared:
1. Hummus, $7 - Delicious. So good, we ordered more

2. Marinated Olives, $5 -  I'm not a fan of olives but I did try one (which was OK). The table REALLY enjoyed it, though.

All to myself:
1. Crushed California Avocado, $10 - I love guac, I love poached eggs and I love crispy chicken skin so to think of all that in one little bowl, I was expecting something bomb. It was actually... just OK. It came with 2 pcs of flat bread but I think I would have enjoyed it more with some kind of chips or something with a harder texture (ie. toasted crouton).

2. Sautéed Gulf White Prawns, $11 - 5 pcs of prawns cooked with white wine, garlic and pimenton (which really tasted like an oily chorizo sauce. It was good but not how I originally imagined it to taste.

The white sangria was awesome! ...all 3 of them!! 

I heard really good reviews about their lunch so I'll have to check that out.
author: Resa N.

description:
Came here on Saturday night and the place has a nice dim ambience. Service was amazing and quick. 

We had mostly tapas items. We had the Beef Tartar, Blistered Shishito Peppers, Sauteed Gulf White Prawns and the Turkish Manti. 

While tasty, the beef taste was somewhat overpowered by the taste of tomato and peanuts. The shishito peppers were tasty, and could've used a little more salt. The prawns were tasty too. The Turkish Manti was really tasty, and I'll be back to try that.

While I'd put the food at about 3.5 stars, the service pushes it to a comfortable 4 for me.
author: Jardin M.

description: What a sweet find! The food and the drinks at Barcha are truly out of this world. The service is not bad, and even when packed, the place remains somehow quiet and intimate. Their menu is always evolving while keeping the favorites around. My four friends and I made a perfect meal out of a huge salad with nectarines, duck meatballs, lentils, hummus, and avocado and egg. But next time, I visit San Francisco, I'm going to fast for a week, and then I'm going to make a four hour reservation at Barcha. Then I will proceed to order Everything on the Menu, and EAT.
author: Gabriela H.

description:
This is one of my new favorite restaurants in the area. I came here for a business lunch with a  group of 8, and we were all impressed with the food and service. The ambiance is great as well.

I ordered the vegetable skewer sandwich, and others at the table ordered salads, skewer sandwiches, and the chef's plate. I also had a side of potatoes. I would highly recommend the skewer sandwiches, as they come with two great sauces (garlic yogurt and cilantro salsa verde), and a choice of a side. The salads also seemed to be great, and the prices are very reasonable in my mind. Considering most lunches in the financial district are around $10-15, it's pretty incredible that you can order a vegetable skewer sandwich with a side for $14 at a nice sit-down restaurant.

I'm looking forward to coming here again for dinner sometime and exploring more areas of the menu.
author: Andrew L.

description:
This place should be labeled $$$. It's pretty pricey for what you get. There are a couple tasty small plates, but you can get the same or better elsewhere for less. I like the decor though.

This is mostly about their very disappointing kale caesar salad. DO NOT GET IT. I tried to have a healthy dinner one night and the waitress recommended it to me. She said it was large enough for a really hungry person with a big appetite and the most popular salad on the menu. 

What a let down it was! It was the size of a garden salad with some sad, dry pieces of kale, 5-8 tiny chunks of beet, super chopped up pieces of egg ( about half an egg total), some croutons and dressing. And for $13. That is not ok.
author: Ai N.

description:
At the suggestion of a friend, we went pretty much around the corner from our Market Street office to Barcha.  She was able to get a reservation at a high top.  Wonderful waiter who too care of us with the right amount of attention. 
I ordered tomato soup and chicken shwarma with side salad and he suggested that I could have soup and shwarma so I did that.  My friend had the orzo salad with lamb.  She had this before but enjoyed it so much that she had it again.
My lunch was delicious! !  Soup was dairy free yet hearty with a drizzle of oil.  Sandwich was crispy on the outside and extremely flavorful.  There is probably a ton of salt but you gotta live right?
We had the Meyer lemon tart which was a good way to finish the meal.  The crust of the was a bit thick for me and the portion could have been bigger.  Filling was perfect.
Definitely coming back soon!
author: B F.

description:
Went here for dinner on a weekday (Wed). There was a small crowd, but the restaurant was not full or even packed and there was available seating.

The menu is small and thoughtful.

Ordered a chopped salad with grilled prawns on top.

A friend ordered the tagine.

The flavors for everything was good, although the salad had overdone it on the olives. The best part of the salad was the prawns.

Biggest issue though, is how small everything was. The salad was teeny tiny and there weren't any veggie-heavy item on the entree menu.

The restaurant's saving grace was the dessert we ordered--basmati rice pudding fritters with apricot jam. Absolutely delicious.

Would I come here again? Maybe? The prices were a bit high for the amount of food. I would be interested in trying some more of the meat heavy dishes, simply because I love Mediterranean flavors.

Overall, great ambiance and very convenient location. Small portion sizes and Fidi prices. Dessert was delicious.
author: Yan F.

description: Please make sure the rice is still warm before serving. Because eating cold rice in cold weather is not fun.
author: Niu N.

description:
Service was excellent, but food and drink were very "meh" and expensive.

For the same amount of $$, you could have a MUCH more enjoyable experience at Kokkari (about 10 minutes away by foot). 

I will not be returning here anytime soon.
author: Jane D.

description: Awesome place with great food and service, very good desserts and wine selection. Definitely a place to go either for a business lunch or for romantic dinner
author: Vadim K.

description: Delightful surprise for weary travelers. Delicious food, excellent service. Wish it were closer to home!
author: Deirdre B.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by this new mediterranean restaurant in the FiDi. A group of eight from work had a holiday lunch at the restaurant. We were seated at the communal table in the back and it was perfect! Service was very fast, despite the restaurant being full and busy during the lunch time rush. 

Everything was delicious. We ordered several of the grilled flatbread and hummus appetizers. The flatbread was amazing! We also ordered the olives and the Potato & Sheep Milk's Feta Croquettes w/ rouille, which were spicy and great! Several co-workers ordered the Chef's plate and said it was very good and flavorful and was served with flatbread and dipping sauces. I had the kale caesar salad and added in grilled shrimp. I loved it and would order it again.
author: Emily C.

description:
Really impressed by this gem. And I'm not even a fan of Mediterranean food!

Sister restaurant of Sens, Barcha is a delightful space with delicious food and outdoor seating to boot. The icing on the cake is the EXCELLENT service. Very pleased with my experience at the bar for pre-dinner drinks (happy hour until 7pm includes items like their tasty, not-too-sweet, citrus-garnished white sangria) and at dinner (Lauren was our server).

Drinks were unique and yummy. Food was dee-lish. Apps: I could eat reams of that Turkish flatbread, particularly in that avocado dish. Entrees: her vivid, enthusiastic descriptions made our mouths water - and did not disappoint. And they were family-style which was nice even for our small party of 3.

I loved my 1st visit so much I came the very next evening with a friend - experience was just as good as the 1st, Lauren was our server again, and I converted my friend into a new fan. Just made a reservation for lunch this week which reminded me to finish this review!
author: Jen E.

description: My fav place for fancy group dinners! love the food and ambiance!
author: Ellie T.

description:
Overrated restaurant in FiDi. Most restaurants in this area are similar: small portions, mediocre food with little to no seasoning and expensive to boot. 

We went for the prix fixe menu on Valentine's Day and we were supremely disappointed. Nothing on the menu (we ordered 7 things) reminded me anything of Mediterranean cuisine. Few examples of the disappointment: 
- Salmon appetizer tasted like salmon cream cheese out of a plastic tub
- Crab salad could fit into my palm
- Beef (main) lacked salt and was completely under seasoned
-Halibut (main) had a bland sesame crust and had guacamole salsa lazily thrown on top

Barcha (and similar $$$ restaurants in this area) takes advantage of the downtown traffic and serve mediocre food. Do yourself a favor and avoid this restaurant and get out of the FiDi area to get something much tastier and better priced.
author: Brian L.

description:
I really enjoyed the grilled flatbread and hummus appetizer.  Also, I went with the braised beef as an entrée which was plated nicely with cranberry and a parsnip puree.

PROS:  It was not crowded on the Thurs night that we were there.  Waiters were attentive.  They kept the wine flowing.  Food was pretty good.  I think I liked the appetizers best.  We also got the Calamari, which was grilled, not fried.

CONS:   Parking can be an issue, but it's SF, what do you expect.  The menu is a bit limited and to be honest, I was hoping to find something that might blow me away.   Everyone has a favorite dish at a restaurant.  I think the selections for me, really were not ample enough to keep me coming back.

OVERALL:   It's a Mediterranean bistro with Parisian influence.  I think that comes through in the food.   It's worth a visit.
author: Peter C.

description:
YUM. 

Came here to have a cute dinner date with my boyfriend, and we had an awesome time! We are both big fans of tapas, and were visiting SF for the holidays, so we decided to try Barcha! We made a reservation, but they have plenty of space, so it may not be necessary on a random night like we did. 

We ordered 2 appetizers: the spicy shrimp and the hummus. Both were super awesome: the hummus, especially! :) They were both very well spiced and perfect for sharing. We also ordered the chopped salad (Greek-style), which had lots of fresh additions like feta cheese, kalmata olives, and grapefruit. For our entrees, we ordered the beef kebabs (INCREDIBLE) and the roasted stuffed eggplant (good, but probably my least favorite dish of the night). Definitely get the kebabs -- I'm not usually a fan of beef, but the fresh mint salad with roasted tomatoes and yogurt sauce with it was really an incredible flavor profile.

Don't forget, tapas can get pricy quickly, so come willing to spend a bit! But you won't be disappointed.
author: Azinda M.

description:
Food and service:Excellent. 

Stopped here for dinner. Because of our dog we sat outside. Weather was decent so we were lucky. 

Plan on having warm jacket if you have/want to sit outside

Some recommendations:

Calamari
California crush avocado
Duck kefta 

The lamb shoulder very tasty but needs to finished rather quickly. Once it gets cold it drys out. 

Presentation, quality, and friendly service. 

Average about 50-60 dollars per person w/o alcohol.
author: Lyman C.

description: Had reservations for 5:45 for a party of 4. When we checked in, we were told we could only have our table until 730.  Odd because I have never received that comment with a reservation... only when I walk in for a table.  We sat down and it literally took about 15 minutes for someone to take our order.  All of our appetizers came out before our drinks even showed up!  The cocktails were really good (earned them one star) but the wine carafe we ordered was just ok.  The food was good -- enjoyed the octopus, kale caesar salad, red pepper dip with soft boiled egg.  We also order the steak kabobs and wished the restaurant gave us more than a butter knife to cut the steak.  The service was terrible.  We ordered dessert which came out along with a comment from the waitress that we had 7 minutes to eat it!  We paid our bill and I went to the bathroom... the waitress came by again around 7:35 saying she needed the table so we had to leave.  Seriously?!  We had a legitimate reservation and were getting kicked out after spending $300 for a party of 4!  Never again will I return to this restaurant.  We complained to the hostess at the front and he claimed the waitress didn't know we had a reservation however, before we were even seated, we were given the "you need to leave the table by 7:30".  So many better places to eat at in SF that do not rush you out on a rainy Wednesday evening where many tables were empty.
author: Linh H.

description: Great kebab. Great service. Great people. Came here once for a business lunch, once with a mentee, and then again with my wife. Always attentive.
author: Johnson H.

description: Barcha is a cute spot in the Financial District for happy hour. My friend and I stopped by for an early Happy Hour on a Thursday night around 4:30pm, and it wasn't busy at the time. We decided to grab a seat at the bar since we weren't going to stay long, and it was great since it was really fun to watch the cooks prepping some of the dishes. My friend ordered a cocktail (I forgot the name), but it was actually really good, and this is coming from someone who has historically not liked cocktails. We also tried the Grilled Duck Kefta (Cucumber, Dijon, Ginger, $12, http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=wUueBIEwb3C1X0ylSs4ylA&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg)- this had good flavor, but the meat patty was too dense for me, so I wouldn't order this again. The flatbreads they were making looked delicious, so I'll have to come back to try those along with the other delicious sounding items on their extensive menu. The most difficult part about coming here is the parking, since there is limited street parking available.
author: Amy D.

description:
My wife and I came here for lunch recently and had a good experience.  We didn't have reservations (I'd recommend to get them as the wait was 15-20 minutes) so instead we sat at the counter in front of the kitchen.  It was a great spot to see how everything was prepared.

We ordered the falafel. It was good and moist but lacked any real punch of flavor.  For our main meal I had the classic shawarma which was delicious.  My wife had the chopped salad with classic shawarma meat.

Everything was delicious but it was a very expensive lunch to say the least.  If it was less expensive, I could see myself eating here more frequently.
author: Blake B.

description: From the very front door to the very back, the decor and atmosphere at Barcha is gorgeous and warm. The service is great; we didn't have a reservation, but I would definitely recommend getting one, especially if you're coming here at lunch on a weekday. I had a lamb shawarma wrap with saffron basmati rice on the side, along with some hummus. The lamb was perfectly juicy, and the bread it was wrapped in, as well as the bread that came with the hummus, was perfectly savory. Again, definitely try to get a reservation; the food and service are worth it!
author: AJ P.

description: I'll make this simple. I came here for lunch for the first time on Monday. Liked it so much that I came back the next day for lunch again. It is that good! The ingredients are fresh and their red wine vinaigrette that they use on their salad is mind blowing. Go. Now. Lol.
author: Michelle M.

description:
I brought my colleagues here for lunch last week. Service was great for a place in its first week of service. 

The four of us started with hummus and falafel, both were fragrant and delicious.  

For our entrees, two of us ordered the chef's plate, one butter salad, and one orzo salad. 

Overall the food was great! The chicken skewers were my favorite. The pork was a bit too fatty so I will try something different next time. 

Also, would love to see more seafood options on the lunch menu. 

Definitely looking forward to coming back and trying more stuff!
author: Mimi T.

description: 3 stars for nice outdoor dining space downtown + excellent cocktails. Food was overpriced and not great at all. We had an array if the appetizers and all were mehh.
author: Alyssa N.

description: Food is decent but overpriced. Ambiance and service is good. There are so many better places to eat in SF.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
Jebus, $48 for two for lunch? That price has to justify some bomb chron food. 

What we had:
- falafel: homemade, but nothing particularly flavorful and was too dry/gritty for my tastes
- chopped salad with chicken: apparently they sous vide the chicken, so it looks raw but isn't... Didn't enjoy the texture. salad had grapefruit and avocado, but $13 + $7 or something for the chicken? Yikes

Service was decent, manager came out to address my concerns about the chicken and took it off the bill.

TLDR: ok food, too $$$$. I ended up stopping at rincon market for some chicken + pita before going back to work.
author: Kristie C.

description:
I really didn't like this restaurant, but it was not technically bad enough to give only one star.

It could be summed up as just another place in the FiDi that gets away with existence because business people need somewhere to take clients to eat dinner, and they can't be bothered to go anywhere deeper in the city with better food.

I would say that the main bummer about this places is:
- dishes were just not that delicious
- dishes were expensive for what you got
- hummus was sour, and I know my hummus.
- waiter sees you at the beginning to take your order, food runners bring you food the rest of the time, and when every plate has been delivered, nobody comes to check to see that you got anything/if you're finished/if you need more. It's like a mic drop.
- big negative points to our waiter, for whom I checked off every small plate we wanted on the menu, gave him the menu, and then when three dishes still didn't come out after we had finished eating everything else, he argued with me that I didn't order them. And then he cleared our plates, without offering to fix it in some way/rush them out. 
We left hungry, and I think our bill was about $100 for 6 people. 

Not recommended.
author: Lara W.

description: Good food, fast, friendly service, cool ambiance, and worth a try.  But not as great as the prices would lead you to believe. Shakshuka should have way more complexity and flavor, and the eggplant main course was so-so. The chocolate pot de creme is fabulous, though!
author: Robert H.

description:
This place is awesome for a workday sit down lunch but because there are so few options in the area there is a little bit of a crutch at lunchtime. Luckily my lunch partner made a reservation so we easily got a corner booth. We even sprung for the sparkling water. 
The menu is pretty simple for lunch but very balanced. I ordered the duck kefta sandwich and potatoes. The duck was delicious. It was moist and well seasoned. I would have enjoyed more pickles to accompany it on the plate. As it was they seemed more like garnish than a side. The potatoes were fine; should have ordered something more appropriate like the rice. 
All in all the meal and the service impeccable.
author: Kathryn B.

description: Fantastic place! Had a great time at Barcha on Friday 2/17; great service and awesome food! Yummy!
author: Yolanda A.

description: My wife and I went to join 3 of our friends who were having dinner here on New Year's eve. We were coming from a dinner and were planning to have a few cocktails and an appetizer or two, before leaving for a party in about 20 minutes, when they were done with their dinner. We were greeted by someone who I can only guess is a manager due to the way he spoke to us and treated us. He explained to us that the only way he would let us join our friends' table was if we ordered entrees, even though half the place was empty and there was space at our friends' table. We offered to sit at the bar, but he kept insisting we purchased entrees. Obviously the management at Barcha cares more about upselling their customers and not much else. If you want to be treated as another check at this place, be their guest. When we mentioned we were going to leave a review about our experience, their attitude changed and they offered to let us stay and order cocktails, but we took our business elsewhere. I wish more places treated their customers nicer on New Year's eve, instead of pushing people to spend more and make more profit because it's New Year's.
author: Tzvetelin G.

description:
Amazing!!

Get the duck kefte, seriously the best thing ever!! Xinomavro and shishito peppers is the best pairing - you're welcome ;)

Good date spot, dinner with Co workers or a quaint birthday dinner. Just go there!
author: Rey B.

description:
Way too pricey for a lunch.
I had the salad with shrimp for lunch. The shrimp was overcooked and the salad was ridiculously small (maybe half the Eatsa bowl). Total without tip was $23...
author: Kinder H.

description: Euro-Mediterranean place below Salesforce office. Nice ambience that suits either for a relaxed business lunch or a dinner date. Great Service. Friendly staff. Really nice cocktails. Smoky Persian which was a smoked cinnamon favored whiskey cocktail was particularly nice. My wife and I liked the duck kefta and potato cheese croquettes.
author: Shyam V.

description: A little upscale for our liking. We sat at the bar. Incredibly uncomfortable bar chairs and cramped. The bar tenders were super cool. Drinks were great! We did ask if the hummus was house made and after they said yes, we ordered it. Well it was store bought 100% and maybe even the sabra brand. As a true middle eastern, I know the difference. Didn't complain though since we were having a good time with our drinks and bartenders. The croquettes were awesome!
author: Tony B.

description:
Came here with my besties for a GNO and was pleasantly surprised with the food, service, and ambiance. I LOVE dim lights and candles and pretty decor so that + the floor to ceilings windows did it for me.

We ordered:

x LABNEH (grilled scallions, olive oil, urfa chili, grilled turkish flatbread) - Honestly, the first bite was whatever, but as we kept eating it was so flavorful. YUMMY.
x HUMMUS (cumin, olive oil, grilled turkish flatbread) - I've had better hummus, but this one had good flavors. It's not as creamy as the ones I'm used to. Different, but good.
x SAUTÉED GULF WHITE PRAWNS (white wine, garlic, pimenton, dill) - I didn't really like this one because it tasted like sausage to me :( I knew it was meatless, but the thought of it put me off. My friends loved it.
x CHOPPED SALAD (gem lettuce, cherry tomatoes, avocado, moroccan black olives, feta, red onion, mint, sumac, pita, lemon vinaigrette) - FAVE! I love me a good ass salad and this was just that. 
SESAME CRUSTED LINE CAUGHT SWORDFISH (avocado, sweet peppers, chermoula) - Eh, I don't know what they were trying to do with this dish, but the texture was just totally off. So overcooked it was rubbery as chicken! So basically I felt like I ate sausage and chicken this meal :(  The green sauce it came with was super good, though.

I think it's a good place for a casual dinner, but I definitely wouldn't crave anything I've tried here. I'd still come back for the nights we don't have reservations anywhere else.
author: Anna M.

description:
Mediterranean tapas?? I'm in heaven! I love Mediterranean food and feel like my options are far and few in between when in FiDi - either fast food Greek, or high-end Kokkari. I am so glad to have found Barcha.

We ordered the following mezze: gulf white prawns, potato & sheep's milk feta croquettes, and hummus. The prawns had that perfect snap and were swimming in a delicious sauce. The croquettes were fluffy potato balls, although I wish the feta came out a bit more. I was stuck on what to order for the third dish, so my waiter recommended me the hummus. Eh, I wasn't in love with this dish - the pita is rolled like an ethiopian bread and is not nearly as fluffy as I wanted. Now I'm left wondering what the merguez sausage tastes like.

Also had a few drinks (forgot their names) that were tequila-based (lots of tequila on this drink list!!). Both were salt-rimmed and perfectly balanced, could easily have kept going but sigh, club wasn't going up on a Tuesday.

For dessert, we ordered the greek yogurt panna cotta with their homemade nutella. The panna cotta itself was divine and so smooth. I thought it was a little weird that it was served with nutella + bananas, which was dense food on more dense food. I would have preferred it paired with raspberries + basil or something.

So excited to go back!
author: Stella A.

description: Solid food and great service. Surprising had availability for 12 people on a Friday night at 7pm. A little pricey for what you are getting, but the tapas and entrees were delicious. We really liked the hummus with flat bread, the beef kabobs, and the crispy potato sides! Ambience was also pretty nice!
author: Sandie G.

description: Came in for lunch on a Friday and the place was packed. We got the Feta-Aleppo Spread for the table and each got our own salads - I got the Arugula and Endive salad and my friends each got the Vegan Quinoa salad, which is composed of mostly (80%) quinoa (so not to be mistaken for a traditional leafy green salad!). The arugula in my salad was a bit wilted and brown, so not the freshest of ingredients. The staff was a bit too attentive and at times I wasn't sure who was in charge of serving our table. We were encountered by at least 4 different workers, one of which was so quick at swooping plates off our table that it just seemed a bit rude. I realize we were there during rush hour, but another waiter completely spilled my friend's dressing, proceeded to wipe the table, but then splattered some of it on me while cleaning up. Despite the service though, I may come back to try other dishes on the menu.
author: Kim S.
