description: Highly recommended  ,the service amazing ,The food is excellent, the house salad is excellent, the falafel is rare, and the dessert is excellent, and the dishes satisfy exactly what we were looking for is not too big not too small ,best thing to share for couple:)
author: Maya M.

description:
Let me start by saying the ambiance is really nice. It's a good space. The cocktails are also great, incredibly unique and well crafted. AND the Bazlama and Hummus (not your standard hummus) are also delicious. The carnivores also enjoyed their duck kefta and lamb meatballs.

So with so many good things, how did they go wrong? Let me tell you... 

We ordered the blistered padron peppers, the server came over to ask if I was finished (with full peppers on my plate). I said no, still working, and he proceeded to clear my plate.

One person ordered a salad, and clearly stated to bring it out without feta (she's allergic). They brought it out with feta. No apology, no comp. 

We all ordered our $30+ entrees, which were underseasoned and unremarkable. I ordered the eggplant and potato brik and can't even remember the flavors 2 days later. But it definitely didn't exude the goat cheese, farm egg, green tahini I'm seeing on the menu. 

So now we're sitting here, and eating, and chatting, and we're done with our meals. Dessert! we say! The server comes over and tells us the kitchen is already closed, and no, we can't have dessert. Are you serious? You didn't think to tell us the kitchen was closing and we should order anything else we may want?? Like EVERY OTHER restaurant?? 

That's ok. At least we have leftovers. Except they gave the carnivore's leftovers to the vegetarian, and vice versa! It's not like they left the boxes on the table and had us figure it out. They clearly gave one to one person, and the other box to me. So no, we didn't think to check their work. Well done. I didn't want to eat it anyways, would have just passed it to the homeless guys. 

It wasn't just the service, it was the food. And for that reason, they unapologetically get 2-stars and 5 people never to return.
author: Dimple B.

description:
I LOVE this place! 

I was able to walk-in on a weeknight for dinner. It's a great place for outdoor seating and big groups or taking your work clients. The ambience is nice and upscale. The staff is very friendly too. 

I did the small plates which are Mezzes. 

1. Chickpea Falafel - this is good but not great. I am a stickler for good falafels. But I recommend trying it

2. WARM RATATOUILLE - this is to die for. It comes with two rolls of turkish flatbread which is plenty. The bread is seasoned really well and very soft. The Ratatouille is something unique and must try!

3. White Sangria - really refreshing. It has a touch of brandy. Lots of fruits. Highly recommend it.

I paid $30 for the above 3 items.
author: Hiral P.

description: Very cool spot , I had a schwarma sandwich ($17 ) with basmati rice and was pleasantly surprised. The ambiance is nice and I think this place is a better option than the neighboring Tender Greens. Service was good as well, will definitely be back...
author: Rod M.

description: Pretty good cocktails and decent tapas although it tends to be less Spanish and more Turkish. Service was quick and friendly.
author: Tina C.

description:
We were so happy to find Barcha! They have a great up-scale causal vibe and most importantly, they have a fantastic, flavorful menu. I would definitely recommend Barcha over the overpriced and overrated Kokkari. Don't get me wrong, Kokkari is very good but I prefer the relaxed atmosphere, excellent service and well-prepared menu that Barcha is home to. This is certainly my new go-to for Mediterranean. 

My favorite dishes: the grilled calamari and the lamb shoulder tagine.
author: Stacia E.

description:
A bit pricy for lunch, but great ambience, delicious food, and wonderful service!  : )

My new favorite go-to place!  I would definitely go again!  

Go early (around 11:30) to beat the rush!
author: Sunny S.

description: Everything was awesome! We tried salads, hummus, desserts, salmon and more. Our server Naomi C was an expert - friendly, knowledgeable, and pleasant. Ask for her!
author: Vicki L.

description: Decent but not great. Have walked by this place several times. It is always busy and the dining room looks inviting. So stopped by to try it out for lunch. Honestly was disappointed with the food, though the service was very good. Despite the fact that we were in a corner and against the windows, our server checked in on us regularly and made sure we were attended to. That was a plus. But honestly the food was disappointing. The best thing I had was the hummas appetizer. But it was a mixed bag. On the one hand the hummus was very tasty and fresh but I didn't care for the flat bread that accompanied it. The bread was fried (which in and of itself is ok if done well) and too greasy for my taste. It made the food seem just too heavy. Same comment for the shawarma I had. It was wrapped in that same heavy overly oily flat bread. Made me want to blot it before eating it.  In addition, the chicken filling and condiments not all that tasty and actually kind of bland. Not that usual medley of flavors you get from the meats, seasonings and sauces in a sandwich like that. I didn't even finish it. Plus, the side of salad that came with it was totally over dressed and soggy. Erg. My friend's salad was fine and she seemed to enjoy it. But overall, the food was to me was just so-so for the price point. There are many good middle eastern places downtown to choose from for lunch, so if you're going to charge that much of a premium (which they do), the expectation and the bar is set higher. I want to pay not just for the sit down dining room, but also for an elevated caliber of food.
author: Lori H.

description: ive been waiting to try barcha for a long time - for the perfect team lunch outing, but it hasnt happened, so my friend and i came to catch up after a looonnggg hiatus.  made reservations for 2 for 11:30 and the place was already bustling with the fidi lunch crowd. whoa - so popular! we got seated after a brief wait and with some confusion as to who was being seated first, and were offered waters and menus promptly. the menu is pretty straightforward - mediterranean styled appetizers, salads with additional protein options (pretty pricey), sandwiches/shawrma, the larger plates, and options for sides. i got the classic sharwma with a side of greens, my friend got the rosemary lamb option with side of potatoes. $18 each. pretty hefty for a lunch sandwich, but its sf fidi.  our food came out relatively quickly, and the portion was just all right - kinda small for $18 but the side greens were hefty and so were her potatoes.  overall taste is rather bland, but the wrap is really oily albeit delicious. i devoured mine because i was so hungry. i think i would come back to barcha to try some of the appetizers and other lunch options...but definitely on a corporate card. the restaurant is very pretty though - and has an outdoor patio if you want to enjoy the sunshine!
author: Christina L.

description: My wife and I have a standing lunch date on the first Monday of every month. This month we decided to try Barcha. Got a call last night to tell me the they were cancelling my reservation because they decided to close July 3. While I appreciated the call it was annoying that they didn't ask if I would like a reservation on another date. They seemed perfectly content to not have my business, so they won't.
author: M C.

description: Honestly, I came here hoping for a fantastic dining experience but it was just a disaster. I sat down and the waitress did not come and serve us for 19 minutes - we counted. The food was ok, but the terrible service made us question how this place stays in business.
author: Andrew R.

description:
Avocado with poached egg?! Yes please. 

I came here on a random dinner with my little sister and really enjoyed my meal. We started off with the California Avocado with a poached egg and it was amazing. That alone would've kept me satisfied. In addition we ordered the spices lamb meatballs, chicken croquettes, and the ratatouille.  Each dish was seasoned to perfection and had such unique flavors to them. 

I was really disappointed that they didn't have the potato and sheep milk feta croquettes. I was really looking forward to trying that when I checked Yelp but I guess that just means I'll have to come back another time.
author: Teresa N.

description:
This place is great for lunch!

I recently tried this place with a friend on a Thursday and we both had a great experience. Even though the place was packed, it felt comfortable and cozy, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Staff could feel rushed under high traffic lunch conditions but not these guys.

The ambiance is beautiful: large, open ceiling and space with mediterranean decor.
The food: we shared a plate with lamb, shrimp, hummus, salads, etc, it was very good -- and I love mediterranean food so when I say it's good, it was good.

I only ate there once so I need to visit a few more times to make sure this is a solid 4 but after the first visit, safe bet they always do it well here. Bon apetit mes amis!
author: Karen M.

description: Was here for a lunch on a Friday.  It was packed.  Food isn't bad.  A little overpriced but who cares it's ok.  2 stars for the food.  Service stunk badly.  I was here for a recruiting meeting.  Was interrupted bu the waiter 4x.  It was clear that they wanted to turn the table.   Not relaxed at all.  Hostesses up front - no smiles, no thank yous.  Should've went somewhere else as we never finished our conversation.  No matter what they say it's clear the waiters were trained this way.  Turn those tables!
author: Gary Z.

description:
This is an amazing Mediterranean restaurant!  Every dish on the menu checks out - Salads, Sandwiches and their shawarma (that my friends had).  I tried Veggie Sandwich.  By the way, Sandwich here looks like a wrap by geometry and in fact, it feels more like a wrap than a sandwich.  

- Nice ambience
- Good Service
- at the heart of the city
- good for corporate lunches

I don't remember having a Mediterranean that tastes this good.  Try it out!
author: Srinath S.

description:
Love this place for the location it's in. The 1st visit was great, 2nd not so great; mainly because our server took forever to get the bill and my food, while everyone else had theirs already (we were also in the cold outside freezing!) 

I have dinned with them 2 times this week. 

KALE CAESAR- Absolutely wonderful and I am so hooked on this dish. The sweet beets at a very nice touch to it and the dressing ratio on it overall is perfect! Must get! I will literally come in, just to get this dish alone. 

CHICKEN CROQUETTES- Another must get dish. Very moist and well done. Inside has a creamy white sauce mixed in but it's not too heavy. The toppings on top is another fantastic compliment. Gotta get 2 of these dishes, as 1 will not be enough.

HUMMUS Flat bread- Another pick me upper for a mid-day snack or pre-lunch app. Well made with tons of flavor.

SPICY PORK TURNOVER- Skip it. Super carb heavy and not all that. Get a 2nd croqueta dish if you want more food.

BLISTERED 'PADRON' PEPPERS- My friend said the yogurt sauce in it was really good. 

Lamb sewer- Kinda dry if you ask me. It's just mehh... Skip it. 

CRISY NEW POTATOES- Ok, not a must have. Simple and plain unless you get a side of their dipping sauces. Even then I would skip. 

WALNUT KATAIFI BAKLAVA- I normally love baklava, but this shredded dessert was kinda a mess. Took one bite and left it. I hated the orange sweetness to it.
author: Carrie Y.

description:
I thought I'd written a review after my first visit but apparently not. I went for dinner about a month ago and was blown away. Everything was absolutely excellent. My wife is a vegetarian so we love places like this and it did not disappoint.
Went again for lunch today and was equally impressed. The hummus, although portion size is small, is amazing. So are the falafels. 
I had the shawerma (veal and turkey) for lunch and it was spot on. 
This place is a bit pricey but food is excellent and worthy of the prices. If you like Mediterranean food you will like Barcha.
author: Matt H.

description:
I ordered the pork sharma and it was really darn good and tasty, just very flavorful... Not too dry . Also came with a side of either salad , rice or potatoes. I would order the potatoes , baked really well. 

I think it was a little pricey for $17, but worth trying. The service was fast especially during lunch time !
author: Nhung T.

description: We came here for lunch since it's close to the office and is always packed. It did not disappoint- so much so a coworker said she was adding it to her weekly lunch rotation!! I had the Kale Caesar and added shrimp + a mint lemonade. It was one of the best salads I've had in a while, fresh ingredients and perfectly seasoned/grilled shrimp. Portions are good, price is moderate - I'll def be back
author: Stephanie H.

description: We had a great time! Our host Mario was very kind and gave great recommendations. The fresh out of the oven flatbread with homemade hummus and ratatouille was really tasty.
author: Charles C.

description:
Wait times can get CRAZY! So get here early or call in. For a light lunch, I'd recommend one of their *more fulfilling* salads i.e. Orzo salad. Came with my favorite sun-dried tomatoes. 

Also great choices include shawarma plates/hummus/falafels. Enough to share or have on your own!
author: Jo L.

description: This is a new spot and I plan to be back for sure. Really enjoyed the ambience and the food a lot. The food was really delish. Everything from the lamb meatballs to the croquettes to the chicken and the tuna. The chocolate tart was rich and hmm hmm good. Service was alright, efficient but almost curt.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Have been here 3 times in the past month and this is definitely the next best lunch place. It's one of those places that you should make a reservation in advance, especially if you're coming for lunch. Great interior decor, well lit, and amazing service. 

I've tried the coquettes, the butter lettuce salad and kale Caesar salad. All great! Added in the chicken and lamb on (different occasions) to the salads and loved it. You'll always see the owner, Kais there actually working the front and pushing out service. He's got great vision and has real passion for food. I'm such a fan of his other restaurant, Sens. Would definitely recommend this place!
author: Gail L.

description: Great place for lunch and dinner! Lots of room to sit so we didn't have to wait at all. We started with the potato and cheese croquettes (as a recommendation from our waitress)... They were so delicious! For lunch, my boyfriend had the chef's plate which was a lot of food but very tasty. And you get to choose your own meats which is nice. I had the shrimp skewer sandwich which was also delicious. I couldn't eat the whole thing though! The best part of the meal is the pita wrap tortilla thing. SO delicious. Will definitely be coming back here!
author: Julia M.

description:
Great place! 
My boyfriend and I went there for diner around 9:30 PM and enjoyed it very much.
We had good wine, beef tartar, ratatouille and rice along with desert for a very decent price given the district.
Enjoyed the ambiance of the place and the staff was very welcoming and nice :)
Would definitely recommend for late diner date !
author: Maud F.

description:
So Barcha has tried to bring down my review a couple of times already. Here is what happened - a waitress denied serving me when I explicitly communicated that I was eating at the restaurant. She made an assumption that I wouldn't tip fair enough. I wonder what made her make that assumption. You tell me?? I was asked to leave and to make things worse the restaurant manager seemed to share her opinion. 
Amazing how these things pervade through our society. Such a shame!
author: Mirant D.

description: Great place if you like Mediterranean food with a hip atmosphere. Their chicken skewer sandwich is awesome paired with the cherry rosemary lemonade (highly recommend).
author: Aava M.

description:
I love this restaurant! I have been here several times during lunch. The waiters have been top-notch each time and been very helpful with recommendations. The atmosphere is generally casual, but very nice nonetheless.

I have tried several of their dishes. I particularly loved the croquettes appetizer and their "Classic" Shawarma.

Price-wise, it is a bit expensive for lunch. However, the quality of the food there is well worth it.

I highly recommend this place!!
author: Sophia W.

description: Good ambience, good food, good service.. I would suggest not asking for server's suggestions and going with you instinct. Beef kabobs were amazing..the gulf white prawns n hummus plate were to die for..
author: Jeena N.

description: The food here is amazing... Love the shrimp tapas  the chicken dish also tasty！the interior design is really warm and relax  I come here almost every week, that's how good they are !!
author: Alicia S.

description:
Excellent food and atmosphere. Casual place with upscale Mediterranean food.

Mezzo favorites were the ratatouille, pastrami salmon, and the hummus. The chicken entree was fantastic. Super tender and delicious. The angus shoulder was also tasty.

Finish it off with Baklava. Of course.
author: Nick M.

description:
Descent enough place for a work lunch.
Large open restaurant with lots of people. Fresh, good food.
author: Kirk M.

description: Not cheap, but super delicious. My advice is you'll be just fine getting a bunch of the appetizers on the menu and sharing with your friends and then getting their specialty drinks. They do lamb and duck perfect! Nice staff, great ambiance.
author: Lauren V.

description: ALL I have to say is WOW!!!! The food here is absolutely phenomenal! Each dish is filled with loads of flavor and scents of fresh aroma. Nothing was a disappointment here! From the amazing staff to the beautiful atmosphere, and GREAT food! This has got to be the top of the cart in SF's BEST foodie places to go! Anything and everything on the menu is made to perfection some of my favorites was the ratatouille, falafel, fish, chicken, and any desert!!!! It's a must. You have got to go here!
author: Ro W.

description: Soooo delicious. The hummus is so creamy (but you must love garlic). The potatoes were crispy and seasoned just right. The salads are a good proportion for sharing with an entrée. They dim the lights over a period of time which helps your eyes to adjust. The music was just a touch to loud with all the conversations going on but other that that the ambiance was great and the presentation and service was great.
author: Car Z.

description:
It's a great spot, nice ambiance, easy to sit and chat with friends and feel comfortable.  Service was attentive.

The food is nothing special.

We came for happy hour which is simply a few wines with a dollar knocked off.  You order everything else off the regular menu

We had lamb meat balls, the duck dish which also reminded me of meatballs,the hummus with this great warm soft flatbread, falafel, and roasted potatoes with two dipping sauces.

The food is all good, no clunkers, but it's nothing you swoon over and want to come back to eat again.

Very convenient after spending time over at Super Bowl City,
author: Foodlover B.

description:
Food is utterly - buttery delicious!

Vegetarian review-Liked the warm ratatouille with bazlama bread a lot.Also gorged on some smooth, lip smacking POTATO & SHEEPS MILK FETA croquettes with paprika aioli.Yum.

In entrees,loved the eggplant and potato Brik with goat cheese, farm egg, green tahini vegetarian dish.

Yummy DARK CHOCOLATE GANACHE TART with orange caramel, toasted meringue, pistachios as desserts were wonderful.

Nice casual place.

New so less crowded and quiet.Great for Valentine's :)

Server seemed a bit nervous and distracted.Had a bad day probably.

Recommended for a quiet romantic meal.
author: Priyanka L.

description:
Great alternative to all of the regular places in FiDI for a group lunch. 

I admit, it's a little pricey for the food that's being served. But if it's a group lunch and on the company dime, I'm OK with it. 

Gets busy, so if you plan on coming here for lunch, come early. Maybe even make a reso. 

The dishes are overall, OK. Nothing amazing, but nothing terrible either. 

We had the hummus and the croquettes for the tables.  Good starters.  I got the chicken kabob sandwich with a side of mixed greens. It was a little on the wet side. I was hoping for the wrap to be a bit less soupy. But JUICY chicken gets a star in my book. The salad was also a bit wet. I'm also keen on a drier salad than a wet one. Big win, huge portions. Good for two meals. 

It's refreshing to see a new place open up in the 'hood. I hope it sticks around.
author: Lisa L.

description: This past Wednesday, I was downtown with a couple friends and decided to try somewhere new. We wanted to get a few bites and drinks and stumbled across this place. Didn't have to wait for a table, and were greeted by our server Mario right away. We split a bunch of dishes, but my favorites were the hummus, and the prawns. Loved the garlic and dill on the prawns. I have to thank Mario for the recommendations, he really knew a lot about the dishes, and was attentive and friendly. Definitely going to tell my friends about how great this place was, and I plan to go back soon!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
I came here with high expectations yesterday afternoon with my team, i ordered the chef's plate with lamb. 

For whatever reason, perhaps the meat was not fresh or not cooked properly? ... I started having stomach pain and nausea within 2-3 hours and didn't sleep at all (hardly 3 hrs). Its almost 36hrs and my stomach still feels bad.

Service was below average - The waiter made us wait 15 minutes+ multiple times while we were looking for him
author: Sunny C.

description: The food is not amazing and the prices and quite high.  I would not recommend it given all the other great restaurants in san francisco.
author: Max S.

description: We had lunch here and the food was really great! Nice selection on the menu!  I had the lamb and it was yummy.
author: J H.

description: Very hip and busy. Beautiful space and good service. The food is very tasty and nicely presented. The shakshuka was a bit too sweet for my liking but otherwise no major complaints. Portions are quite small.
author: The A.

description:
We tried this place out last night.  My partner's friend from college was in town for work and we wanted to take him to a restaurant that offers more unusual dishes and that is within walking distance to his hotel and so, check & check!  

When we arrived, at around 7pm, the place was rather empty, with only about 2 tables occupied.  Soon after we were seated, our server asked us if we wanted to order any drinks.  We asked for a little time to get acquainted with the menu.  Within a few minutes, while we were obviously still discussing food choices, he was back again about the drink order.  At that point, we felt pressured to look at the drink menu and make a decision.  When we did, we were dismayed to see that the font for that menu was a size 8 or 9, too small for aging eyes, especially in combination with very dim lighting.  We finally settled on a carafe of very dry Turkish wine.  But the whole experience up to then was not exactly pleasant, with a server that is gruff and impatient.  Fortunately, after our drink order, the rest of the evening flowed better.

We ordered the following dishes: Crushed avocado, olive oil poached tuna, duck kefta, hummus and crispy new potato side dish.  My favorite items from all the dishes turned out to be the flatbread that came with the avocado and hummus and the potato side.  The flatbread was sooooooooo buttery and perfectly garlic-y.  The potatoes were exactly as described, and the simplicity of it is divine!.  While everything else is good enough, there was nothing outstanding to make me want to come back for more.  

And while our experience with our server ended in a neutral note, I would advise the management to keep closer tabs on the staff in general.  For example, we noticed an employee (trainee?) knock down a jacket hanging on a customer's chair while passing.  Instead of picking it up, he turned his head to observe what he did, then continued on!  Also, though the restaurant was less than a third full by the time we were wrapping up and there seemed to be a good amount of people working, they were so behind in bringing out food that the chef got involved in serving!  With so much competition, these little details can really affect the rate of repeat customers.
author: Yvette F.

description: Usually really good! But today when grabbing takeout they gave me a chicken skewer wrap instead of my usual shrimp skewer wrap. Sad!
author: Dan S.

description: I've been meaning to try this place for a while and finally had the pleasure to have dinner here on NYE with the family.  We had a three course dinner and each dish they brought out was tastier than the previous one.  For mezzes we had the merguez sausage and crushed avocado and for our entrees we had the lamb shakshuka and angus beef kebab. Everything was fresh, tasty and flavorful.  The ambiance is trendy and customer service was great as well.  I highly recommend Barcha, it was a great experience overall.
author: Mariam A.

description: I've done takeout from here thrice. Really like the kale salad, the meatballs, croquettes, falafel. If you like salmon shmears, the tarama is really good too.
author: Govind W.

description: I've eaten a lot of Mediterranean food. Some taste much better than others and this place is one of them. Has a very professional but casual ambience to it. Seating was provided promptly for us during the lunch hour. You are not overwhelmed with too many options which is a good thing and allows you to focus on the food. All items we ordered were delicious and we literally licked our fingers during our meal. Would definitely recommend trying it out.
author: Alistair N.

description: Fancy Mediterranean food. It's San Francisco cuisine at its truest. What does that mean? Casual high-end food at a reasonable price! Come for a nice lunch/dinner!
author: Danny W.

description: A friend and I picked this spot for dinner, we really loved the ambiance, dark and just the right amount of noise. The staff is really nice and the food is delicious! The ratatouille is definitely a must try. Lots of vegetarian Mezze options, however, just 1 vegetarian entrée.
author: Bhavya K.

description:
Lovely atmosphere, with upbeat Latin music (odd for a Mediterranean place) to make us forget it's cold outside. 1pm on a Friday and there was plenty of seating outside, and enough inside without a wait.

A little pricey if you order anything with a meat protein so be mindful. As lovely as the vibe was, the chairs are kinda cheap; very rickety, hard, pokey and uncomfortable. I had to ask one of my party to switch with me and I sat in a booth so I could enjoy my lunch. 

I got the orzo salad with falafel on the side which was yum (with a nice little tzatziki cream), and my friend got a quinoa salad which she liked. The description on yelp says small plates, but they are actually huge with decent portions. I will definitely try it again, but probably as takeout (because of the chairs). The rosemary-cherry lemonade was good and the mint lemonade was like a virgin mojito.

We are coming back next month for our office holiday party, so I hope the chair issue is addressed and more comfortable seating is chosen. As they are in the Sens family of restaurants, I was surprised at the low-budget choice, given the rest of the décor. They just opened a few weeks ago, so I will make allowances for these hiccups, but I hope initial problems are addressed and this becomes a successful place. Since I work in the same building, I want a conveniently located restaurant with tasty options to make it past the one year mark.
author: Carolina R.

description: Omg!!! What amazing food- the menu honestly doesn't do the food justice. Beautiful outdoor intimate seating. The service is incredible. The plating is beautiful- makes .you want to eat more and  more. The flavor and quality of the food is superb!!! Who thought a salad could ever taste so good!
author: Natasha M.

description: This is a good place. I was skeptical at the beginning because the area has never been very famous for good places. The decor is a little funny but the dishes were really good, well made and light. So, overall, I cannot say I am a fan but, if I happen to be in the area and need a good place for lunch or dinner, I would be glad to stop by.
author: Luca R.

description:
This is an amazing new restaurant for multiple reasons:
- THE place to be for a business lunch centrally located in the FiDi with colleagues or clients as they are very efficient despite being extremely busy and there is not much wait (15min max).
- The food is refined, simple, flavorful and very well proportioned with a large choice for gluten free, vegetarians and vegans ( very hard to find).
- The Happy Hour is great for groups as we experienced and the "Mezze" ( Small plates) are the perfect late afternoon, early evening bites.
- I already went there multiple time for dinner and the experience was amazing for everything mentioned above but their hospitality and flexibility just reflect perfectly their dedication to their "Mediteranean" theme not only in their attention to details in their food but in their hospitality which is paramount in the culture when you travel there.
This was much needed 
Thank you Barcha
author: Misterjo R.

description: This place was kind of lame.  The menu looks cool, but the food was not particularly compelling.  And, who serves shakshuka without thick bread?  So weird.
author: Jessica F.

description: I went here for lunch, and had a great experience. The address of the restaurant completely tripped me up. It's actually on Fremont between Market and Mission. But I digress. I had the orzo salad and the goat cheese just about melted in my mouth. I added a shrimp skewer and that made the lunch just filling enough. I also had the hummus, which was really flavorful and creamy. I'd definitely recommend it and I will go back again.
author: Lori M.

description: Great resto to catch up with friends over yummy Mediterranean food in the mid of fidi. Plates are huge, so you better go with an empty stomach!
author: Beril Y.

description: Very bad service by the host stand. Disorganized and they skipped me twice waiting for a seat. Time for some changes!
author: Chris H.

description: Not the best food here. I order a sandwich from menu. And it was not a sandwich, it was freakin wrap. I dont know why they just call it wrap. Worst thing about wrap, it was open both side. The taste awful. Will never come back again. This should $$$$. Its expensive place.
author: Deep S.

description: Very good Turkish bread, lamb meatballs , chicken dish.. Persian rice is good but I've had better . I can't wait to try them for lunch.
author: C A.

description: This place was actually a good choice, so nice and comfortable. I went there with my best friend. She loved it. Great food and amazing dessert. The lamp meat ball is really delicious. :):):)
author: Pandora P.

description: This is for the happy hour which I've now been to twice.  Yum!  Good food and drinks.  I could eat the entire plates of shrimp and hummus myself.  Can't wait to try a full meal sometime.
author: e w.

description:
That. Was. Awwwwwesome. Fantastic food and atmosphere.

Had the hummus and olives app plus the Rosemary pork sandwich with side salad

Ohhhhj, the flavah!
author: Steve N.

description:
Great service, great food. A bustling atmosphere (sit in the back if you want it a bit more quiet for a business lunch), and they have one of the few outdoor dining areas downtown, which we have been sorely lacking in SF. 

They have one of the best lunches in FiDi, but i'm not alone in that opinion, so you'll want to get reservations. Even as busy as they are, I've never had to wait more than a few minutes for a reserved table and there's never been a delay in my food coming out of the kitchen. Even at the busiest time, when the place is packed, my water glass is kept full.

I've made it part of my regular rotation now and I haven't had anything there that I didn't like. The salads are great, but I have a difficult time not ordering the Schwarma when I go.  The Classic (Turkey and Veal) reminds me of a Schwarma I had once in Paris. I asked for the recipe, but no luck. If any of you are able to weasel it out of them, let me know! The sandwich is big enough to take 1/2 of it home if you're not famished - I'll often start with a small plate and then do exactly that.

If you sit at the kitchen counter you can see them making everything they serve - and it all tastes homemade.

My company hasn't used them for catering yet, but waiting for my table the other day a woman was bragging that her company brings in food from Barcha every couple of weeks. Maybe I need to switch companies, Ha!
author: Mark P.

description: Lunch here at 11; had a reservation and all tables were filled by 12. Very good food and service. We had lamb gyro with greens, lentil soup, English (green) pea falafel and panna cotta. Everything delicious and served with a smile. Very near BART in downtown SF. Highly recommend.
author: Ileinie W.

description:
I came to dine here on a Monday night upon hearing that they just received their full bar liquor license (of course I still got wine) but also because I was craving the  fatoush salad (which is unfortunately AND fortunately ) only on their lunch menu. I asked our waiter for another salad recommendation and he told me a popular option, which was the kale Caesar, and then his favorite which was an endive salad which I can not remember the name. I am glad I took his recommendation because I will be coming back for this salad now.  It was so fresh, and delicious my mouth is watering now just thinking about it. With sliced apple, cranberries,  and candied nuts, you would think it was going to be a really sweet salad.  What was great was that the light citrus dressing, onions, endive, and point eyes blue cheese really balanced it out and all together made such a great combination. I wasn't too hungry, and my boyfriend to his regret had just filled up on fries at a nearby bar so we decided to go straight to dessert from there. We got a chocolate dessert which I unfortunately also don't know the name of, but it had a toasted marshmallow looking swirl on top which had a light hint of lemon in it. It was rich and went well with the wine I was drinking. I've tried desserts like this at other places and I got to say, Barcha nailed it. 

The ambiance was romantic with gold lamp fixtures that displayed lovely designs all over the walls, and candles at every table. Even the manager wore a beautiful red dress that was very fitting to the mood of the restaurant. 

Over all, everything was delicious and our server had great descriptions of the wine for me and knew what to recommend. We'll be back for sure!
author: Tracey P.

description: At the recommendation of an awesome colleague, I was able to try the Chef's Plate for myself with a dear friend during a work lunch. And my oh my was the experience amazing. Ambiance was beautiful-imagine wicker chairs, with Sens patio furnishings and ethereal light fixtures. Though I've never been, Morocco comes to mind to describe theme and decor. Food left me feeling so fresh and so clean clean and was absolutely nommylicious! We tried the falafel with a fresh underlying flavor of Meyer lemon and Chef's Plate $24 (able to feed 2 ppl generously and 3 comfortably). This tasting platter came with choice of shawarma (we chose classic-I don't recall what type of meat but it was yummy), choice of skewer (2 that we were deciding on were lamb and shrimp-we decided lamb), crispy potatoes, side of mixed greens, saffron basmati rice, Turkish bread (with 3 sauces-garlic yogurt, cilantro salsa verde, and spicy harissa). Will definitely be returning and would love to try their Walnut baklava next time!
author: P C.

description: This place is heaven. Get seasoned shrimp and chicken skewers with the garlic yogurt and spicy harissa and your life will change.
author: Naji S.

description: Lots of indoor and outdoor seating, good option for a client lunch downtown.  Great salads on the menu.  It is harder then you think to find healthy full-service lunch options in the financial district that don't break the bank.  Barcha fills that void.
author: Andrew R.

description: Amazing food and super friendly staff. Shared a few mezzes with a friend. Loved the vegetarian ratatouille. The duck kefta and the grilled calamari were tasty as well. Our Turkish friend got beef kebab and was impressed, which was a big deal.
author: Wen G.

description: I've had Turkish, Syrian, Lebanese, Greek, Persian, etc. etc. shawarma. THIS IS THE BEST YOU CAN FIND IN CALIFORNIA. I wish they had one in LA. Unbelievable quality and taste. By far the BEST in the city!!
author: Sagar P.

description: Barcha is right across the street from my work and I was seated immediately in the front (counter?)  Ordered, Falafel appetizer, chopped salad and the chef's plate.  All the dishes were plenty flavorful.  Ordered beer on tap and wasn't very cold.  Since I loves Mediterranean food and it's so close to work, I will definitely come back.
author: Katie C.

description: I have been here twice and I would have given my first visit 5 stars.  My second visit was only 3 stars.   Food is mostly excellent, service is a bit spotty....very inconsistent.   I ordered the same thing twice and once it was good and once disappointing.  The wines are pretty terrible.  I might come back and try them again.
author: Kelly M.

description:
So delicious!!! First place we ate at in SF & it did not disappoint. We tried the duck kefta first which was amazing! Then had the lamb rack and the angus filet for our entrees. Both of them were melt-in-your-mouth amazing! Service was great. Also we had a bottle of the grenache kuvee blend. So good and you can't beat it for $40 for the bottle! 

Finished with the baklava for dessert. A little hard but yummy none the less!
author: Heavenly D.

description:
We had dinner on a Monday night which was perfect- not overly crowded, we weren't rushed and the food was perfect. I'm big on ambiance and seating locations when dining and I can honestly say this place has it all going for them. We ordered for 3 of us to share 

Hummus to start
Chicken 
Tabouli 
Rice
Potatoes 
Shishitto peppers 
Lamb meat balls 
Chocolate mouse for dessert 

Dinner total with 2 beers was $215. Not cheap but we felt like we got our money's worth and no one left with an empty belly.  

Everything was amazing and perfectly cooked. The wait time between ordering and having it arrive was very reasonable and the service was impeccable. 

Highly recommend for a date downtown or after work dinner.
author: Kristy I.

description: I Went there during my lunch and they were busy but still able to provide the proper level of service. Had a glass of white wine and the classic shawarma and my coworker had the shrimp and lamb dish and it was flavorful and affordable.
author: Steven G.

description: Love this place!! Both lunch and dinner are delicious. Especially love the endive salad with chicken kabob added, house made pita bread, kale salad, beef kabob (dinner), ratatouille, and lamb meatballs. Outside seating, when it is warm out, is nice. Super nice staff!
author: Laura W.

description: Just went here for lunch; it was busy, but I got great service and was seated within 5 minutes. Food was awesome and I'm not much of a foodies, you won't hear me say that food is awesome too much. The hummus might have been the best I've tried in SF.
author: Daniel R.

description: Nice atmosphere. I was in a hurry so ate quick .,.I had the labneh and duck keftah which were delicious. I will come back to try more of the menu !  Happy hour until 7 and open during the afternoon when many places are closed (330pm).
author: jocelyn b.

description: I came here on a whim and did not expect a 5-star experience - but I really had no substantive reason to rate it any less. I had about 6 tapas - from good to stellar. Unique cocktails (okay happy hour specials). Prices were high - but fair. Genuine waitress and consistent water service. Fun vibe and nice atmosphere (check out them chandeliers!) Great effort from the team and I hope this place can stay around for the long haul.
author: Howe L.

description: The house platter is my favorite because you get a sample of most of there meats. The kefta and the croquettes were seasoned really well. Service was pretty good. They are very busy at lunch time.
author: Tina C.

description: This place is awesome. I work at a cafe nearby and noticed that the owner would come in twice a day, generally with an eight hour increment between visits. He invited me in to check it out and I took him up. The food was amazing, the California Avocado dish was stellar and the Prawns were next level. The cocktails are also excellent and unique. The staff is super friendly and seems happy to be there, and guests also looked very pleased. Don't sleep on Barcha, this place is great.
author: Jesse S.

description: Barcha is fantastic! Excellent food and very fresh/healthy. Great outdoor patio as well. Highly recommend!
author: Dom P.

description: Amazing pork shawarma sandwich! The meat is tasty and plenty, the "bread" is more like a wrap but so much better. Every delicious for $18. The chef's plate is 2 meats with all the sides, and essentially the deconstructed sandwich, for $23. I wish there were more lunch options though. Oh and always make reservation.
author: Lisa Z.

description: We had an excellent dinner here tonight.  The food was spot on!  We ordered shrimp, hummus, calamari, croquettes and the beef skewers.  Everything exceeded expectations!! The shrimp and the croquettes were some of the best we have ever had.The service was attentive and friendly, but not pretentious. The ambience had beautiful decor and was casual, clean, and relaxing. This is a great space for a romantic or a casual dinner.
author: Helen F.

description:
My sisters and I visited this new Mediterranean dining spot in the heart of downtown San Francisco for a late lunch and were very pleased. I had the lamb kebab sandwich.  Very flavorful and also very juicy, which makes it a bit hard to eat with decorum, but worth the effort.  The sandwich comes with your choice of one side--crispy new potatoes, bulgur wheat or mixed greens.  I had the crispy new potatoes which were very good--outside crispy inside creamy smooth.  At $17, the price is a bit high for the portion size, but the overall quality is very good.

The wine list  is heavy on Mediterranean wines,  Greek, Turkish and Italian. Two pours are offered, a 3 ounce and a 6 ounce.  I had a full-bodied Italian red that was a perfect accompaniment to the lamb sandwich.  We did not have dessert.  

Entrees were a bit slow coming from the kitchen considering the restaurant was mostly empty.  San Francisco is a seaport, so the restaurant should have more seafood offerings. An olive oil broiled salmon and a prawn sandwich are the only seafood on the menu.  I originally ordered the salmon, but they were sold out.  A fish of the day would be a welcome addition, as would a soup of the day.  It was a cold day when we ate there and soup would have hit the spot just right.

On the whole we enjoyed our visit to Barcha, and intend to return again.
author: patrick c.

description: Walking by hungry - stopped in - stayed! Drinks great; ratatouille phenomenal; everything was so good, I am definitely coming back. Service was quick friendly and alert. I can't be more positive! Thank you Jason for the attention and everyone for the experience.
author: C.m. H.

description: Pretty delish food, not super expensive considering it's in downtown SF.  My gripe is they charged us $1 for soda refill, and $3 for extra side of bread without telling us in advance that there will be charges for these refills.  Our waitress offered to us and we assume, just like 95% of restaurants, refills are free, so we said Yes Please!  It's only a few dollars, so no big deal, but certainly unexpected unpleasantly.
author: CalBear H.

description: It was good quality Mediterranean food. Some of the best I've had since I visited that part of the world. My one issue with their menu was that there were not too many options that were not a sandwich. I ate outside, which was nice for the business lunch I was having. I think it would have been hard to have the conversion inside during the lunch rush, because it was so loud inside. I do recommend trying it out. I'm going back
author: David M.

description: I do not get the good reviews at all. I just got done eating one of the worst lunches I've ever had at Barcha. The appetizer we ordered (potato croquettes) was actually really tasty, but the main course I ordered could not possibly have been more disgusting! I ordered the Classic Shawarma Sandwich (veal/turkey). The sandwich looked very good when it arrived, but I had to spit my first bite into my napkin. The meat they put in this sandwich was at least 50 PERCENT fat and gristle. It was completely flavorless, if you don't count all nasty fat crunchiness and cartridge. I'm not sure what they are doing wrong at this place -- shawarmas are meant to be ultra lean due to being cooked so slowly. Major fail at this restaurant. I would NEVER eat here again and would not recommend it to anyone. Absolutely revolting! Save your money and eat at the Halal cart around the corner from this place.
author: Andrea N.

description: Solid sandwiches and soups. Very crowded between noon and 1pm. Fairly fast service after 1pm. Reasonably quiet for a business discussion.
author: Sean W.

description: This place was definitely not a 4-star restaurant! The lamb dish was way overcooked and overpriced considering what you get, quality wise. The chicken dish was mediocre. Appetizers were the best part of the meal but it's pretty hard to mess up on hummus.
author: G G.

description: Fabulous food, we ordered a lot of mezze and two entrées and there wasn't a miss in any dish. Delicious flavors and lovely presentation. Pretty spot for a Saturday night.
author: Sari M.

description: Perfectly decent food, and actually quite healthy, but didn't quite live up to my standards, as I frequent Dearborn, MI.  Had a hummus appetizer and a duck kefta salad.  Salad may be better later in the year, when the ingredients are more fresh.  Would have loved a stronger mint flavor!  I bordered on giving this 3 or 4 stars, but decided on three due to the price relative to what I had.
author: Gerry C.

description: Came here for lunch with some former colleagues. Everyone demolished their food. I got the classic shawarma. The meat melted in my mouth like a true Turkish delight!
author: AUDRA M.

description: Very, very pleased with the food and service at BarCha. I had been looking for a local SOMA restaurant that has great food, great drinks and is not dead on the weekends. I'm thinking this will become my new go to restaurant in SOMA.
author: Maximillian Y.

description: Pricy lunch.  $13 kale cesar salad + $7 chicken.  Food was great (prefect dressing although didn't taste much of anchovy in the dressing; chicken was moist).  However, portion was light and $20 lunch is on the high side for me.
author: Yen F.

description: Great place to grab lunch, big potions, tasty food, it comes very quick which makes it ideal for lunch breaks!
author: Aliki F.

description: Hands down my favorite lunch spot in the financial district. Reasonable prices, great service and a nice relaxing setting. Their hummus is fantastic. So is the shwarma. I've also been there for dinner and had a fantastic experience. I was also particularly impressed with how the manager interacted with the guests and supported her team.
author: Kelly B.

description: Impressive but missing the Middle Eastern / Mediterranean touches. Yes the foods have spices and the place is really nice but it still leaves someone yearning for something more that this place can't deliver. In a way it feels unauthentic.
author: Abraham A.

description: Really delicious! We had basically every mezze- the sausage with egg, the calamari, and the rice fritter dessert were my favorites.
author: L B.

description: I went here last night. The food tasted good, but I got food poising a few hours later. It has been a miserable ~18 hours
author: erik l.

description: I had lunch today with 3 co-workers and we had a terrific time, the setting is quite nice and even though it was packed the tables are far enough part that the noise levels are good. Three at the table had salads with a meat topping, all were fresh and well proportioned. I had a lamb sandwich which was very tasty and had large nuggets of very tasty lamb, my only request next time would be to go lighter in the yogurt dressing as it made the bread a little too soggy. Everyone really enjoyed the meal and the wait staff could not have been nicer. We also had some time considerations and were out in about 50 minutes without feeling at all rushed.
author: renee m.

description: My favorite was the chicken croquettes and local lamb meatballs!!! Delicious!! There was no wait on a Friday night, service was great, and ambiance was romantic...overall a great experience. Would recommend to anyone in the area!
author: Helen W.

description: Good spot. Noisy at lunch. Quieter at dinner. Good food. Had lunch there last week. Server (male) was VERY abrupt in presentation
author: Bruce J.

description: Get the croquetes and the classic shawarma and thank me later. I come here at least once a week. I bring a new person each time and they have never failed me. Best shawarma ever...
author: nikkita l.

description: Had dinner at Barcha for the first time. The food and service were so great. They were so accommodating with my gluten allergy. There were many options and so many healthy and delicious choices. Loved the homemade hummus. The service was also attentive and thoughtful without being too imposing. Can't wait to go back!
author: Kimberly K.

description: I can't do much for a restaurant that CHARGES FOR SODA REFILLS. And I'm talking fountain soda! Was never told there was a charge. When I pointed it out on the bill and asked the waitress about it, she did not offer to remove it. This place is not inexpensive to begin with, and charging $1 for a fountain soda refill is ridic. Limited menu. Was there for lunch. Only dip they have on offer is hummus. We were offered additional pita to go with the remainder of our hummus (they bring you one, uncut). We were charged $3 for that additional pita, and again, never told about it when the waitress *offered* to bring us one. The potato/feta croquette sauce was really bad, and the croquettes themselves were bland. We had two salads with shrimp, the croquettes, an order of hummus (plus an extra pita bread for $3) and two sodas (plus that lovely $1 refill charge!) and bill was over $68. For lunch. Will not be returning here. Ever. I'm not cheap and will happily pay for great food and service, but I feel nickel and dimed at a new restaurant that should have been thinking about long term success instead of how to bleed every customer out of any extra charge they can think of. I hope you'll spend your dollars elsewhere. This city certainly has better Mediterranean fare. For a high-end meal in this genre, hit Kokkari - it earns its reputation, the menu is deeper and much more compelling, and while not inexpensive, you also won't leave with a bill full of BS add-on charges.
author: Teri F.

description: Thank you barcha! Had a great time with great food. The beef kabobs were amazing and the service was great!!! Can't ask for more.
author: Caroline R.

description: Underwhelming overpriced food and slow service.   Not worth it unless you work like a block away.
author: Kevin C.

description: We picked up takeout today from Barcha for a lunch meeting at work in the office building next door.  First hiccup:  their takeout menus they are passing out do not have the phone number on there.  Okay, so I looked it up.  Second hiccup:  Called at 10:30 am to request a takeout order for 11:30 pickup, and the lady on the phone says she cannot take any orders until the kitchen opens at 11:00.  Say What?!  Called back at 11:00 and line stayed continuously busy until my fourth attempt at 11:15.  Placed order, was told it would be ready in 15 minutes.  Walked to get the food at 11:30 and it was ready and waiting for me (good), and they had provided enough utensil packs for the number of entrees.  Good.  We ordered two of the chopped salads, with shrimp added, one classic shawarma and one chicken skewer sandwich, and some sides for folks to share:  the potatoes and the bulgur.  Everyone liked what they had.  However, the chopped salads were not chopped at all.  There was no chopping that had been done on these salads.  They were full leaves of little gem lettuce, with the other ingredients mixed in.  Tossed does not equal chopped.  A CHOPPED SALAD SHOULD HAVE BEEN CHOPPED.  The shrimp that was included with each chopped salad was in the container with the salad, but was still on the skewers as it had been cooked.  It was very messy to get the shrimp off the skewers, with plastic utensils.  I would recommend taht they take the shrimp off the skewers in the kitchen, for salad orders.  The potato side dish was amazing--some of the best roasted potatoes I've ever had.  Very crisp and flavorful.  The bulgur was also tasty.  We will order from there again.
author: Mary Lou H.

description: What a lunch find...the food and service are exceptionally great! We ordered the shrimp sandwich with the green salad and it was perfect! We will definitely come back soon!
author: Theresa S.

description: Love this place!  But it is a tad pricey.  Good food though and service was good as well.
author: Joanne C.

description: I've never had to give a bad review but I am writing this as a cautionary tale about making reservations at Barcha.  About a week and a half ago, my 2 friends and I made lunch reservations for 1:00 pm at Barcha.  When we arrived at about 5 minutes to 1:00 pm, we saw 3 people at the front desk, pouring over a computer.  They asked us to wait.  And we waited and waited, and saw that they sat 2 other parties (who just walked in off the street) before us.  They did not even try to accommodate us (we saw an empty table with 2 chairs -- most restaurants would have added a third chair and sat us).  We finally left at 1:12pm because of the total unprofessionalism of their staff (neither of the 3 people at the front desk appeared to know what they were doing).  Come on Barcha, if you're going to train people, please do not do so during a busy lunch hour.  And please don't seat walk-ins before those who already have reservations - that does not look good for you.  This story has a happy ending, however:  We went and ate lunch at another restaurant, and the staff at that restaurant is like a breath of fresh air compared to the clueless people at Barcha's front desk.
author: Sharon L.

description: Tasty Mediterranean food at a slightly above moderate price.  Our party of seven had six appetizers and two main dishes and a handful of drinks for $175.  This place has not caught on yet.  It is run by the same people who have Sens in the Embarcadero.
author: Hank H.

description: Ambiance nice. Service decent. Salad good. Avoid the leg of lamb kebab. It's like dog meat
author: Mo A.
